title: Video Ads Editor Long Form
description:
Video Editor (VSL & Direct-Response Ads) â€“ Remote

Company Description



We are a fast-growing health-focused e-commerce brand operating primarily in the DACH market (Germany, Austria, Switzerland).

Our core product is a CE-certified medical back decompression device, sold via direct-response advertising (Meta,
, Instagram, YouTube).



We focus heavily on long-form VSLs, short-form ad creatives, and conversion-driven video content.



Role Description



This is a remote, contract-based position for a Video Editor with a strong focus on VSL editing and performance marketing creatives.



You will work closely with our marketing team and receive:



Fully written scripts



Clear creative direction



Examples of winning ads and VSLs



Your main responsibility is to turn scripts into emotionally engaging, high-converting video ads by:



Editing and structuring video content



Sourcing relevant stock footage or clips when needed



Creating AI-based content (UGC-style clips, avatars, or b-roll)



Syncing visuals tightly with script pacing and emotion



This role is execution-focused â€” strategy and scripts are provided.



Responsibilities



Edit 3â€“5 minute VSLs and shorter ad variations



Assemble videos using provided scripts and guidelines



Source or generate supporting visuals (stock, b-roll, AI tools)



Create direct-response style edits (hooks, pacing, clarity, emotion)



Occasionally create AI UGC-style content or short clips



Deliver clean, structured files ready for paid advertising



Required Qualifications



At least 1 year of video editing experience, preferably for social media or ads



Solid understanding of direct-response video structure



Strong English communication skills (at least B2/C1)



Proficiency with common editing tools (Premiere Pro, After Effects, CapCut, etc.)



Ability to follow instructions precisely and meet deadlines



Willingness to iterate and improve based on feedback



Nice to Have (Big Plus)



Experience editing VSLs or long-form ad content



Familiarity with AI tools such as:



Veo 3



Sora 2



AI UGC/avatar generators



Basic understanding of performance marketing (hooks, retention, CTA timing)



Work Structure



Remote



Initial commitment: ~16 hours per week



Possibility to scale to full-time within 6â€“8 weeks



Flexible schedule, but fast turnaround and responsiveness are important



Personal Qualities We Value



Strong attention to detail



Ability to follow systems and instructions



Willingness to learn and adapt quickly



Reliability and clear communication



Long-term mindset (we prefer ongoing collaborations)



How to Apply (Important)



Please apply via the Google Form below (preferred).

We use this to ensure applicants can follow instructions.



Google Form Link:




/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSc_luFN0n8fbRNQ2QVoVlQsZXONKO-t7JE70yaZQkAsO_7VLQ/viewform?usp=dialog

title: Growth & Revenue Operator
description:
We are hiring a Growth & Revenue Operator to partner directly with the CEO in scaling a womenâ€™s health DTC CGP brand currently generating approximately $55K per month in revenue.



This is not a VA role.

This is a strategic execution role.



You will help bring structured growth thinking, disciplined execution, and revenue accountability to the business.



You are not expected to replace the CEOâ€™s vision.

You are expected to help turn it into measurable results.



What You Will Own

â€¢ Build and maintain weekly revenue dashboards

â€¢ Track CAC, AOV, LTV, retention, and subscription metrics

â€¢ Identify bottlenecks and propose focused growth initiatives

â€¢ Structure and manage 90-day growth sprints

â€¢ Coordinate creative testing with paid media and content

â€¢ Optimize subscription and affiliate performance

â€¢ Build and document SOPs for all growth workflows



What Weâ€™re Looking For

â€¢ Strong understanding of DTC growth fundamentals

â€¢ Comfortable with Shopify analytics and subscription metrics

â€¢ Thinks in tradeoffs and prioritization

â€¢ Able to make data-backed recommendations

â€¢ Works US hours

â€¢ Proactive, organized, and disciplined

â€¢ Comfortable pushing back respectfully with logic



Experience with Klaviyo, subscription apps, funnel math, and project management tools is preferred.





What Success Looks Like in the First 90 Days

â€¢ A clear revenue dashboard built from scratch

â€¢ Weekly KPI reporting rhythm established

â€¢ A defined growth sprint in motion

â€¢ At least three structured experiments running

â€¢ All major growth processes documented





Application Process

Step 1: Video Submission

Record a 2 to 3 minute video answering:

â€œHow would you approach scaling a $55K per month DTC brand to $100K per month within 3 months?â€



Focus on prioritization, not volume of ideas.



Step 2: Sample Work

Submit one example of a dashboard or reporting framework you have built.



Step 3: 100-Day Growth Plan Exercise



Selected candidates will be asked to sign an NDA and receive limited brand data including:

â€¢ Current revenue

â€¢ AOV

â€¢
 list size

â€¢ Subscription percentage

â€¢ Traffic sources

â€¢ Product mix



Based on this information, you will outline a focused 100-day growth plan including:

 1. Top 3 revenue priorities only

 2. Specific initiatives within each priority

 3. Weekly KPIs that would be tracked

 4. What you would stop or deprioritize

 5. Key risks and tradeoffs



This exercise is designed to evaluate strategic thinking, clarity, and prioritization.



We are not looking for 30 ideas.

We are looking for focus and revenue logic.

title: Video Editor â€“ Short Form & Paid Creative
description:
We are hiring a skilled Video Editor to help drive content and paid creative for a fast-growing womenâ€™s health DTC brand.



This is not just an editing role.



This role exists to turn raw footage into scroll-stopping, conversion-focused content that supports growth across organic and paid channels.



You will work closely with the CEO and Growth Operator.





What You Will Create

â€¢ High-performing Reels and TikTok videos

â€¢ Paid ad creatives for Meta and TikTok

â€¢ YouTube Shorts

â€¢ Founder-led talking head edits

â€¢ Test variations of the same creative

â€¢ Long-form repurposing into short-form assets



You will help build a creative engine, not just edit clips.



What We Expect From You

â€¢ Strong understanding of short-form hook structure

â€¢ Ability to edit for retention and pacing

â€¢ Strong instincts around scroll behavior

â€¢ Understanding of direct-response creative principles

â€¢ Ability to test multiple angles from one raw video

â€¢ Organized file management and content library systems

â€¢ Comfortable working with performance feedback



You should be able to explain why an edit performs, not just how it looks.



You Will Also

â€¢ Build repeatable editing workflows

â€¢ Create branded templates

â€¢ Organize content by theme, offer, and campaign

â€¢ Document editing SOPs

â€¢ Collaborate with paid media to produce testing variations

â€¢ Help scale creative output without sacrificing quality





What Success Looks Like in 60â€“90 Days

â€¢ Consistent output of 3â€“5 short-form pieces per week

â€¢ Creative variations built intentionally for testing

â€¢ Improved retention metrics on short-form content

â€¢ Paid creative structured for performance, not aesthetics

â€¢ Organized creative library with clear labeling





Application Process



Step 1: Portfolio Submission

Submit at least 3 short-form examples. Include one that feels direct-response oriented.



Step 2: Why This Role Video

Record a 2â€“3 minute video explaining:

	1.	What makes short-form content convert?

	2.	How you think about retention and pacing

	3.	How you would approach editing for a founder-led brand





Step 3: Editing Test

Additionally, this position involves administrative duties to support the efficient operation of the organization.

Qualifications:

title: Real Estate Investment Underwriter
description:
The Real Estate Investment Underwriter is a core decision-maker responsible for evaluating residential properties across multiple exit strategies to determine whether a deal meets the companyâ€™s investment criteria. This role directly impacts company profitability by validating assumptions, stress-testing scenarios, and ensuring every approved deal has a clear, executable path to profit.  The Underwriter is the gatekeeper of company profitability. Every deal we do, or avoid, starts with this role. Strong underwriting protects the company from bad investments and ensures capital is deployed only where risk is understood and returns are justified.



The Underwriter analyzes properties under three primary scenarios:



1) Off-Market / Investor Sale (Cash)

2) On-Market / As-Is Condition

3) On-Market / Renovate & Resell at After Repair Value (ARV)



This role is not theoretical â€” your numbers drive real capital deployment and are utilized for critical decisions.



The ideal DISC style is a High C / Mid D / Moderate S / Moderate I - someone who is obsessed with accuracy and data integrity, naturally skeptical of assumptions, strong at risk identification, comfortable slowing things down to get the numbers right, process oriented and analytical, loves numbers, and questions everything.  This person should be able to work independently and take ownership of outcomes while being able to defend their analysis/numbers if a deal does not work.  



Key Responsibilities



Investment Analysis & Deal Underwriting

- Analyze residential properties to determine as-is value, investor value (off market), and After Repair Value (ARV)

- Run detailed financial models for multiple exit strategies

- Validate deal viability using company investment criteria (returns, risk, timelines)

- Stress-test assumptions (pricing, repairs, hold time, market shifts)

- Clearly determine DEAL / NO DEAL decisions on opportunities



Valuation & Market Analysis

- Pull, analyze, and interpret comparable sales (on-market and off-market)

- Adjust comps accurately for condition, location, timing, and renovations

- Track market trends and pricing shifts to ensure current, defensible valuations

- Evaluate neighborhood-level risk and liquidity



Rehab & Cost Analysis

- Verify repair assumptions align with resale strategy and buyer expectations

- Apply appropriate contingency and cost buffers to protect margins



Profitability & Risk Management

- Ensure every approved deal meets required profit margins and return thresholds

- Account for all costs: acquisition, rehab, holding, financing, selling, and overhead

- Identify deal-breakers early to protect time, capital, and resources

- Flag high-risk variables before commitment



Communication & Decision Support

- Present underwriting conclusions clearly to acquisitions, leadership, and partners

- Defend valuations and assumptions with data and logic

- Provide quick, confident feedback to support fast decision-making

- Maintain underwriting documentation for accountability and post-deal review



Required Skills & Experience

- 2â€“5+ years in real estate underwriting, investing, acquisitions, or valuation

- Strong understanding of:

     - After Repair Value (ARV) methodology

     - Investor pricing models (70% rule, margin-based underwriting, etc.)

     - Rehab cost estimation

     - Holding costs and deal timelines

- Advanced proficiency in Excel / Google Sheets (financial modeling required)

- Deep familiarity with MLS data, comps, and market analysis

- Ability to thoroughly underwrite deals with detailed accuracy

- High attention to detail with strong judgment under pressure



Ideal Candidate Traits

- Profit-driven thinker â€“ understands that numbers = real dollars at risk

- Decisive but disciplined â€“ confident making DEAL / NO DEAL decisions

- Skeptical by nature â€“ pressure-tests assumptions instead of accepting them

- Process-oriented â€“ consistent underwriting methodology

- Ownership mindset â€“ treats company capital like their own



Compensation

Pay rate: $8-$10 per hour, based on experience, plus bonus 

Schedule: 40 hours per week (It could be more based on workload)

Training: Yes, training will be provided.

description:
We are seeking a highly organized and proactive Virtual Assistant to join our growing exterior services team. In this role, you will be the backbone of our daily operations, managing the essential "behind-the-scenes" tasks that keep our construction, window cleaning, and power washing projects moving forward. Your primary responsibilities will include scheduling appointments, responding to client inquiries via
 and phone, and maintaining an accurate job calendar. You will also assist with basic invoicing and data entry, ensuring that our field technicians have all the information they need to provide top-tier service to our residential and commercial clients.



The ideal candidate possesses exceptional English communication skills and a "can-do" attitude, especially during our high-demand seasons for gutter cleaning and snow removal. We are looking for a tech-savvy professional who can quickly master our CRM software and navigate the logistical challenges of a service-based business. Because we operate across multiple service linesâ€”from intricate construction builds to rapid-response snow clearingâ€”adaptability and attention to detail are critical. title: Full-Time GoHighLevel (GHL) Level 1 & 2 Support Agent - Client-Facing Technical Support
description:
We are seeking an experienced, full-time GoHighLevel (GHL) support specialist who excels at day-to-day client assistance â€” NOT complex workflow building or automation development.



You will be judged more on simple, practical support tasks â€” like helping a client trace what workflow a message came from in the Conversations tab â€” than on building advanced automations.



We already have builders. We need someone who lives in support tickets and understands how real clients use (and sometimes misuse) the platform every day.



You will receive training on our specific processes, tools, and clients, but not on the fundamentals of the GHL platform itself. You must already have strong, practical knowledge from real client-facing support experience on GHL.





Key Responsibilities:



- Provide Tier 1 & 2 support: troubleshooting workflows, triggers, tags, conversations, calendars, campaign optimization, and common user questions.

- Onboard new clients to GHL (account setup, snapshots, basic workflows).

- Guide non-technical clients through practical platform usage with patience and clear communication.



Required Experience & Skills:



- Proven client-facing GHL support experience (onboarding AND ongoing daily support tickets) â€” not just personal or agency building.

- Deep knowledge of everyday user issues: tracing messages to workflows, fixing conversation routing, tag failures, calendar sync problems, etc.

- Excellent English communication (written & spoken).

- Full-time availability with overlap in US time zones (Arizona/Phoenix preferred).



This is a 100% remote, full-time position (30+ hours/week).

Paid via PayPal/Payoneer or similar.



How to Apply:

To be considered, please apply with:



- Submit a short video introduction (1-2 minutes max, recorded via 
 or similar free tool â€” unlisted YouTube link also fine). 

- In your written application please include how many months/years you have in client-facing GHL support (exclude personal or internal agency building only).

- Approximate number of clients you have onboarded AND provided ongoing support to.

- 2â€“3 specific examples of practical support issues you've resolved (e.g., "Helped client trace an inbound message to the correct workflow using the Conversations tab" or similar real ticket examples).

- Your current time zone and daily availability for US overlap.

- Attach resume/portfolio if available.



Serious applicants with real GHL support experience only. Generic applications or those without the required examples will not be considered.



We will review applications and reach out via the platform for interviews.



Thank you!

title: Sales Manager (flexible hours) English Fluent
description:
I run a friendly Creative Media Agency specializing in AI-generated videos and video editing. We have an exciting opportunity to run our sales and marketing department and begin a job with significant growth potential. We are a start-up, and we will rapidly increase your pay if you deliver great results. Our website 



Commission is 20% of all profits made from the first 3 months of a sale, assuming you did not mislead the customer. Alternatively, you can work for no base salary and receive 50% of all profits from a customer, forever (note that a single good sale could be worth millions of pesos).  



The role has no fixed working pattern; you complete your hours whenever you like during the week, making this great for a mother or a hard-working business or marketing student.



To apply, you should be a master of low-cost advertising, though as your sales grow, your marketing budget will increase. Please include your resume, how many weekly hours you want to work, and what commission you would prefer. Note that affiliates, those who want to work on a no-base-salary basis, will be hired automatically, as there is next to no downside for us.



We sell the following, all at $7 an hour:



Virtual Assistants

AI Video Creation

Digital Artists

Video Editing

Recruitment



We also sell a variety of personalized gift services, including songwriting, photobooks, music videos, and AI movies.



The job is versatile and suits someone who can work autonomously. You would suggest, run, and plan campaigns focusing on the products you want to sell. We have a large number of lead generation techniques, and we will train candidates.



Your job may also involve some monitoring and posting across our many social media accounts.



We will consider part-time applicants. Obviously, part-time staff will be paid less (pro rata), with commission unaffected.



Requirements

Fluency in English

Sales background

Honest

Can follow instructions

Hard working (weâ€™ll track your activity in your first few weeks)



Ideally, you can also:



Work autonomously

Study and think about your job analytically.

title: On-Camera YouTube Video Creator (How-To Videos)
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE



We produce short educational videos explaining U.S. business topics such as LLC basics, EIN steps, BOI rules, and state-specific guides.

This is a full-time, high-volume role focused on repeatable, script-based production.

You will present calmly on camera using scripts provided by our team and deliver fully edited, upload-ready videos.



MUST-HAVE REQUIREMENTS | NON-NEGOTIABLE

-Comfortable speaking on camera

-Clear neutral American-style English

-Ability to explain topics calmly and clearly

-MUST submit a 1-minute video sample



PRODUCTION VOLUME | READ CAREFULLY



We publish at scale. Strong performers typically produce 40â€“60 finished videos per month.

Each video means:

-Recording

-Basic editing

-Final upload-ready file



This role suits people comfortable with:

-High-volume repeatable production

-Structured script-led content

-Consistency over creative reinvention



RESPONSIBILITIES

-Record educational videos from scripts

-Basic editing | cuts | cleanup | simple visuals if needed

-Deliver upload-ready final files

-Maintain consistent audio video and presentation quality

-Re-record short sections when required

-Record simple voice-overs for short clips



REQUIREMENTS

-Clear spoken English with good pacing

-Confident natural camera presence

-Reliable microphone and basic lighting

-Basic video editing capability

-Ability to follow scripts closely



COMPENSATION | WORK STRUCTURE

-$800 per month

-Full-time | 40 hours per week availability

-Long-term contract for the right fit

-Performance judged on output consistency and quality



HOW TO APPLY



Record a 60â€“90 second video explaining:

-What is an EIN?



Upload video | Drive | YouTube | Loom

Share past work if available

Use subject line:

-Video Producer | Your Name | Earliest Start



Applications without a video sample will NOT be reviewed.

title: Full Stack Developer - 3 POSITIONS AVAILABLE
description:
This role is full time UK business hours.



We're a business that provides kick ass software / print services to travel businesses. We're looking for competent / experienced full stack developers to join our team and help make our software the best it can be. The skills you need are:



REALLY GOOD SPOKEN / WRITTEN ENGLISH

GOOD MATHS

PHP

HTML / CSS

Javascript (AJAX / JSON)

MySQL



If you're the guy (or gal) your developer friends come to when they're stuck, then we want you on our team! We're not looking for 'another developer' w're looking for people who want to become part of our business 'family'. You need to be prepared to work hard and in return we'll provide good pay, a great environment and job security. Lastly you need to be passionate about travel! 



You'll learn all about how vacations / holidays are made (packaged) and the 'official' things that have to happen in the background, including how we ensure suppliers are paid and customers receive the right documentation etc...



For the right person this is a job for life; 13 months pay (each year), bonus payments when targets are met, and a family first approach. Need  to fit your working day around collecting your children from school - no problem, need to take time out to cook / shop for your parents - no problem. We want you to be 120% happy and create a better life for you and your family. 



We understand that electricity and internet can be intermittent sometimes in the Philippines. If we need to buy you a solar battery bank to keep your laptop charged and router connected - we will. If we need to get you spaceX internet - we will. 



Sometimes things get lost in translation, so we asked Darlynne (our Philippines Team Leader) to share her thoughts on what its like to work for us:



---



Mga kababayan ko (in the tune of Francis M)



Witty ng intro ko, no? Haha! I hope from that ramdam niyo na we foster a positive and fun culture dito. Teamwork to the highest level! Whatâ€™s even better is the work-life balance. Yung business owner (Tim) ay mabait at sobrang understanding, so kung may kailangan kang asikasuhin (lalo na if itâ€™s about family) magsabi ka lang. We will always understand. 



Since we provide a strong and supportive working environment, mataas din ang expectations namin sa inyo. Kailangan hardworking ka, responsible, at marunong mag-manage ng tasks mo. Relaxed ang environment, pero challenging ang trabaho, ha? Weâ€™re a software company that works with major holiday brands, kaya expected ang high-quality output at all times.



Kailangan talaga magaling ka sa English â€” both spoken and written. Hindi yung umaasa lang sa Google Translate, kundi talagang kaya mong makipag-usap nang maayos at malinaw. Importante kasi na madali ka maintindihan ng UK team at ng clients. At ikaw din, dapat naiintindihan mo sila. Kung feeling mo kailangan mo pang i-improve ang english mo, okay lang â€˜yan! Mag-practice ka muna then apply ka ulit after 6 months 



The company is growing, and marami pang opportunities coming for those who are willing to grow with us. Kung gusto mo ng challenge at long-term growth, magandang opportunity ito.



Iâ€™m so excited to welcome you to our family!



---



IF YOU APPLIED PREVIOUSLY AND ARE STILL KEEN TO JOIN OUR TEAM, PLEASE RE-APPLY BUT LET US KNOW YOU APPLIED BEFORE AND TELL US WHAT YOU'VE DONE TO IMPROVE YOUR SKILLS SINCE WHEN YOU LAST APPLIED.



To apply for this role you must complete an application using the link below:

title: Social Media & Ads Manager.
description:
We're looking for a full-time Social Media & Ads Manager to handle content creation, social media management, and paid advertising for a faith-based brand with a growing podcast, Substack, and online business. This is a fully remote, asynchronous position. Communication happens through Basecamp.



What You'll Be Doing



Content Creation & Social Media Management



You'll take podcast episodes, Substack articles, and B-roll footage and turn them into platform-specific content across Instagram, TikTok, YouTube Shorts, Pinterest, LinkedIn,
/X, and
. This includes:



Clipping and editing podcast episodes into short-form video clips with hooks, captions, and platform-native formatting

Creating Instagram carousels from podcast transcripts and Substack articles using Canva templates and a custom GPT

Building and resizing content for each platform (vertical for TikTok/Instagram/YouTube, square for LinkedIn, landscape for
, 2:3 for Pinterest)

Writing captions for all platforms using a custom GPT

Creating static and video pins for Pinterest with SEO-optimized titles and descriptions

Producing B-roll videos from existing footage with trending concepts

Promoting weekly Substack articles through 
 static pins and
 posts

Promoting lead magnets through Instagram posts with ManyChat automations and Pinterest pins

Building ManyChat keyword automations for Instagram carousels and lead magnet promotions

Managing Pinterest boards, repinning evergreen content, and tracking search trends

Cross-posting content to

Researching trending content ideas weekly and presenting them for approval





Meta Ads Management

You'll manage
 and Instagram ad campaigns with a monthly budget of $500-$1,500. This includes:



Running 1-3 campaigns at a time (new leads, lookalike audiences, retargeting, and launch campaigns as needed)

Building all ad creative (images, video, copy) and submitting for approval

A/B testing 3-5 creative variations per campaign, changing one variable at a time

Monitoring campaign performance daily (CPL, CTR, CPC, frequency, relevance score)

Flagging issues on Basecamp when campaigns need attention

Scaling winners and cutting underperformers (with approval)

Delivering a weekly ads report every Monday on Basecamp





Reporting

Weekly ads report with spend, results, creative performance, and recommendations

Monthly social media report (due by the 5th of the following month) covering platfor
trics, top-performing content, hook performance, platform growth, Pinterest search trends, and specific recommendations for the following month





Administrative & Special Projects



Assist with administrative tasks and special projects as needed.



Weekly Volume

This is the approximate weekly output across all platforms:

TikTok: 7 videos + 2 carousels

Instagram: 2 reels + 3-4 B-roll videos + 3 carousels + 3 lead magnet posts

YouTube Shorts: 7

LinkedIn: 0-2

/X: 2-4

Pinterest: 5 video pins + 3 static pins + 2-3 idea pins + 3-5 Substack pins + 3 lead magnet pins

: 3 Substack promotion posts + cross-posts from TikTok and LinkedIn

ManyChat automations: 2-3 per week (plus lead magnet automations)

Meta ads: 1-3 active campaigns with daily monitoring





Many clips are reformatted across platforms, so the unique content created per week is approximately 20-30 pieces.





Tools You'll Use

Opus Clips / Opus Pro (clip selection and captions)

Canva (carousels, pins, cover images, ad creative)

Custom GPTs (caption writing, carousel creation, Substack promotion)

ManyChat (Instagram DM automations)

Meta Ads Manager (campaign management)

Google Drive (transcripts, video uploads)

TikTok (native captioning)

Basecamp (all communication)

Google Sheets (approval spreadsheet, reporting)



Requirements

Experience managing social media accounts across multiple platforms

Experience running Meta 
/Instagram) ad campaigns including A/B testing

Proficiency in Canva

Experience with ManyChat or similar DM automation tools

Understanding of Pinterest SEO and search-based content strategy

Ability to edit short-form video (clipping, adding hooks, captions, sound effects)

Strong written English

Self-directed and organized enough to manage a high volume of deliverables asynchronously

Comfortable working independently with weekly check-ins rather than daily supervision





Details

Full-time, remote

$850/month

Fully asynchronous via Basecamp (no required overlap with US business hours)

Start date: TBD

title: Hiring Executive Team: Gamers Wanted
description:
We're looking to hire a full team of VA's to work with us launching TikTok ad campaigns for our agency, RedStream Consulting (
).



There are multiple positions to be filled based on experience. We're looking for data entry VA's, team leaders, managers, video editors, media buyers, and project leads.



Pay starts at $600 a month and increases with performance. We reward performance and timeliness. 



Roles currently available:



1. Business Center Creators:  You will be responsible for creating TikTok business centers daily for us that we run ads on. Everything is clearly defined, and simple to execute. SOPs that teach everything take 30 minutes to finish. Only real qualifying trait we're looking for is full availability during working hours to communicate with team, and attention to detail. Fast workers will be able to create 6 business centers an hour, normal workers around 4 an hour. We're looking for fast.



2. Form Creators: You will work with the business center creators above to populate each business center with forms (standard TikTok advertising options) following our instructions. 



3. Campaign Creators: You'll create campaigns inside the business centers. Gaming computer needed here because it's simple task but needs lots of tabs open. If computer is weak, that's the bottleneck. (example: on a decent computer it takes 5 minutes to do this task, on a slow computer can take 30)



4. Top Up Specialists: High trust position, highest pay. You'll be trusted with our credit cards and asked to top up the ad accounts inside the business centers on a set cadence (once every 15 minutes for example). You'll also be looking at metrics to see which ones are worth topping up, and which ones are not. Attention to detail and financial responsibility very important here.  We require two of these positions per pod. Candidates with ACCOUNTING background preferred.



Quick video explaining how the team will function together: 



To apply, answer the following q's in a QUICK LOOM VIDEO. I need to see what you're like and looms are the best way of doing it. 60 second length is enough as long as you explain the q's below:



1. Which position are you interested in?

2. 8 hours a day shifts, are you okay with that?

3. Do you have a gaming PC? List the specs if yes.

4. Do you have any prior experience running ads, being inside business centers or ads dashboards?

5. Why are you looking for work right now?



PS: After initial trial period, performance will be HEAVILY rewarded



Looking forward to scaling together!

title: Virtual Assistant â€“ Real Estate & Mortgage (Stable High-Performance Environment)
description:
Virtual Assistant â€“ Real Estate & Mortgage (Stable High-Performance Environment)



We are building a stable, structured, high-performance lead handling system for a real estate and mortgage brokerage in Washington State.



This is not a freelance gig.

This is a long-term professional role with clear expectations, strict structure, and strong bonus upside.



At the very top of your application, write the words:

Structured Performance Operator



Applications without this phrase will not be considered.



WHAT YOU WILL DO



Your #1 priority: Speed to Lead



- Call new leads within 1â€“3 minutes of arrival

- Confirm inquiry (MLS home search requests)

- Qualify: Cash buyer or financing needed

- Send mortgage application link (if financing required)

- Schedule loan consultation appointment

- Log EVERYTHING in CRM



After new leads are handled:

- CRM follow-up tasks

- Appointment reminder calls

- SMS reminders through CRM

- CRM cleanup and organization

- Later expansion: recruitment calls, partner outreach (after system stabilization)



All calls and messages must go through CRM.

A US RingCentral number will be provided.



WORK SCHEDULE



We operate 7 days per week.

Two shift VAs cover the week with structured handoff periods.

Each VA works approximately 36 hours per week, including brief handoff overlap.



Each VA works approximately 3 full days (10-hour shifts) and 1 partial day (approximately 6 hours).

You do NOT work 7 days per week.

Each VA has multiple full days off every week.



This is a fixed schedule role.



COMPENSATION



Base Salary: $650/month

Paid twice per month:

- $325 on the 1st

- $325 on the 15th



Base salary is paid regardless of closings.



PERFORMANCE BONUSES (PAID AFTER CLOSING)



Bonuses are paid in the payroll cycle following confirmed transaction closing and after commission/funds are received.



Initiator Bonuses (paid only if the transaction closes):



- $10 â€“ Completed mortgage application

(paid to the VA who sent the link, drove completion, and logged it in CRM)



- $10 â€“ Loan appointment that shows up and results in closing

(paid to the VA who scheduled and logged it in CRM)



- $10 â€“ Cash buyer appointment that results in closing

(paid to the VA who scheduled and logged it in CRM)



Transaction Closing Bonus:



- $200 per closed transaction



This bonus is shared between the two shift VAs who worked the lead during the process.

The initiating VA (who initiated the mortgage application or appointment in CRM) receives the larger portion.

The supporting shift VA receives the remaining portion. Exact split defined during onboarding.



Teamwork matters. Follow-up matters.



PERFORMANCE EXPECTATIONS



At 60-day review, we expect total earnings (base + bonuses) to reach approximately $1,200/month once the system is fully operating.



Top performers should be able to earn up to $2,000/month in strong production months as volume increases.



Earnings are performance-based and not guaranteed.



SYSTEM RULES



- ALL calls must go through CRM.

- ALL SMS must go through CRM.

- RingCentral number is for business use only.

- Calls are recorded.

- Speed to Lead is mandatory.



Intentional bypass of CRM communication process or misuse of RingCentral may result in immediate termination.



TO APPLY (REQUIRED)



Answer clearly in numbered format:



1) Can you consistently respond to new leads within 1â€“3 minutes during your entire shift?

Explain how you ensure this technically (workflow, notifications, monitoring).



2) Describe your specific experience handling inbound real estate buyer leads (not cold calling).

Include:

- Type of leads

- Volume per day

- Conversion goal



3) List all CRM systems you have used and describe your level of usage (basic / advanced / automation / reporting).

If you have not used BoldTrail or KV Core, explain how quickly you learn new CRM systems.



4) During your shift hours, how many active conversations (calls + SMS + follow-ups) can you handle per day without missing Speed to Lead targets?



5) Confirm clearly:

You will make 100% of calls and send 100% of SMS strictly inside our CRM system only.

No exceptions.



6) Confirm clearly:

You will not use RingCentral for any personal or unauthorized activity under any circumstances.



7) Describe your internet setup:

- Primary provider

- Speed (upload/download)

- Backup connection

- Power backup (if any)



8) Write a short sample call opening script for a brand-new inbound buyer lead requesting MLS access.

The script must:

- Confirm their request

- Ask cash vs financing

- Move toward scheduling a loan consultation if financing is needed



Applications without direct numbered answers will not be considered.

Motion graphics (After Effects)

AI-assisted video workflows (responsible use)



Weâ€™re excited by AI as a tool, not a shortcut. Youâ€™ll use AI to improve speed and quality, for example:



 â€¢ transcription / captioning

 â€¢ experimenting with AI-supported motion/graphics workflows



Youâ€™ll always keep outputs brand-safe and client-appropriate, and weâ€™ll be clear on what tools are approved for each project.



What â€œgoodâ€ looks like



 â€¢ You can take a brief + footage + notes and make smart editorial decisions without hand-holding.

 â€¢ You keep projects organised, versioned correctly, and easy to review.

 â€¢ You communicate clearly, flag risks early, and deliver on time.

Requirements (must-have)

-style notes)

Nice-to-have

 â€¢ Understanding of brand guidelines and template-based editing

 â€¢ Familiarity with tools like 
, Dropbox/Drive, Notion/Monday-style workflows

title: Looking for a part time Shopify Builder/Designer
description:
Hi, please read the entire job description carefully and follow the application instructions below precisely. We are looking for a long-term, part-time Shopify Designer and want to ensure we find the right candidate. Responding correctly is required and will not be a waste of your time.



We are an established business serving multiple clients primarily in the US market. We already have a dedicated team based in the Philippines and we're excited to add another talented individual who enjoys their work and is passionate about design.



What we are NOT looking for:

A web developer that writes code.

A graphic designer that is good with photoshop.

A general VA that can do everything.



What we are looking for:

Someone with a great eye for design that can do research and find inspiration

Someont that can take a design and implement it with drag and drop platforms such as Shopify page builders, Klaviyo, Elementor and more.



About the Job:

This role includes building new Shopify stores, redesigning existing ones, creating landing pages inside shopify and building
s in Klaviyo. Tasks might also include creating
 newsletters, social media posts, editing images, designing ad creatives, and occasionally assisting with general design-related tasks based on your skills and our ongoing needs.



We value attention to detail, creativity, reliability, and the ability to meet deadlines. Excellent communication and design skills are crucial for success in this role.



Hours and Terms:



This is a part-time role with flexible hours. You can be paid either hourly or daily, based on an agreed schedule.



You must have a stable, fast internet connection and your own computer.



We require a quiet working environment to ensure focus and productivity.



How to Apply:

Please reply by providing:



A link to your portfolio showcasing your recent work that is relevant to this role.



A short video introducing yourself and briefly explaining your design / building experience.



Additionally, clearly answer these questions in order:



Which types of design tasks do you enjoy the most, and which do you prefer the least?

Is your internet connection reliable for regular voice and video calls?

What design software are you most proficient in? If we tell you to build the same landing page on 4 different platforms you have never used before, do you consider that a challenge?

How would you rate your English writing and speaking skills?



Looking forward to your reply.



Thank you,

Tal

title: Link Inventory Partner (50â€“100 Links/Month | Non-Casino | Under $100 CPL)
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE



We are hiring experienced link inventory owners | publisher relations specialists who already control real publisher relationships and can place links directly.

This is NOT an outreach-from-scratch role.

This is NOT a VA training position.

If you already place 50â€“100 quality links per month using your own vetted publisher list this role is a strong fit.



WHO SHOULD APPLY



You should apply ONLY if you:

-Already manage your own publisher inventory

-Place links monthly at smallâ€“medium scale | 50â€“100 links per month

-Work exclusively with non-casino non-adult sites

-Maintain average total cost per quality link under $100

-Understand link risk in YMYL niches | legal | business | finance



IDEAL BACKGROUND



We strongly prefer candidates who:

-Worked at SEO agencies or link-building vendors

-Operate as independent link brokers or publisher managers

-Have long-term direct publisher relationships

-Control pricing | no reseller chains | no middlemen



REQUIRED SITE TYPES | YOU MUST ALREADY HAVE THESE



Your existing list should include:

-Business | legal | finance blogs

-Editorial websites with real traffic

-News-style or authority publications

-Guest-post-friendly sites with manual review

-Clean domains | no spam | no penalties



WE ARE NOT INTERESTED IN

-PBNs or expired-domain networks

-Link farms or auto-approve sites

-Casino | adult | CBD | crypto-heavy properties

-Mass outreach operators without owned relationships

-"We can try to find sites" applicants



PRICING LIMITS | STRICT



We buy links ONLY within these ceilings:

-DR 45â€“50 -> up to $45

-DR 50â€“55 -> up to $55

-DR 55â€“60 -> up to $70

-DR 60â€“65 -> up to $90



RULES

-Dofollow + contextual only

-Permanent placement

-Minimum link life | 3 years

-Blended average CPL must stay under $100



HOW THIS WORKS



You share your existing site list with:

-URL

-DR

-Traffic

-Niche

-Your price



We select approved sites

Orders placed in monthly batches

Payment made per live placement



No cold outreach

No guessing

No wasted time



WHAT WE PRIORITIZE

-Monthly repeat buying

-Bulk orders

-Long-term partnerships

-Predictable delivery

-Clean execution | anchors | relevance | footprint control



HOW TO APPLY



Send the following:

-A sample list of sites you already control | Google Sheet preferred

-Your realistic monthly volume capacity

-Your preferred payment method



Subject line:

-Link Inventory Partner | Your Name

title: Content Operations Lead (Own Writer Team + Delivery Responsibility)
description:
==================================================

IMPORTANT â€“ READ THIS FIRST

==================================================



We are NOT hiring writers. We are hiring ONE person who already manages writers and can fully own a content delivery pipeline.



If you are a writer, VA, or someone who plans to hire writers after joining, this role is NOT for you.





==================================================

ROLE SUMMARY

==================================================



You will own the delivery of high-quality, human-written, long-form content at scale. We already have a senior editor who reviews and approves quality. Your responsibility is delivery.



You will:

- Manage writers

- Ensure content is delivered on time

- Replace underperforming writers

- Hit monthly volume consistently



You own output. We do not micromanage.





==================================================

WHAT YOU WILL OWN

==================================================



- A team of 5+ writers (your responsibility, not ours)

- Writer onboarding and replacement

- Daily and weekly content delivery

- Meeting monthly word targets

- Ensuring content is NOT AI-generated or generic



You will NOT:

- Write articles yourself

- Ask us to hire writers

- Ask us to manage day-to-day tasks





==================================================

CONTENT TYPE

==================================================



- Long-form articles (1,500â€“3,000 words)

- Practical, experience-based content

- Pain-killer content that removes confusion

- Not fluff, definitions, or AI-style writing



We provide:

- Detailed outlines

- Editorial direction

- Feedback from a senior editor





==================================================

REQUIREMENTS (MANDATORY)

==================================================



You MUST meet ALL of the following:

- Currently or previously managed at least 5 writers

- Delivered 200,000+ words per month before

- Understand how to enforce quality at scale

- Can replace writers quickly if quality drops

- Comfortable owning delivery end-to-end

- Want a long-term role (6â€“12 months minimum)



If you cannot meet ALL of the above, do NOT apply.





==================================================

COMPENSATION

==================================================



- Fixed monthly pay (not per article or per word)

- Stable, long-term engagement



Compensation depends on demonstrated capacity and quality. You are expected to manage writer payments within your own structure.





==================================================

TRIAL / VALIDATION

==================================================



Before full onboarding:

- Short paid pilot

- Small batch of articles

- Quality reviewed by our editor



If quality and delivery are strong, we scale immediately.





==================================================

APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS (IMPORTANT)

==================================================



To apply, reply with ALL of the following:



1. How many writers do you currently manage?

2. What niches have your teams written in?

3. Maximum monthly word volume you can reliably deliver

4. How you ensure writers do NOT use AI

5. One example of content your team produced (editor-approved)



Applications that do not answer ALL 5 questions will be rejected without response.





==================================================

FINAL NOTE

==================================================



This role is for someone who wants to OWN a system, not do tasks. If you are looking for stability, long-term work, and responsibility, this will be a good fit.

- A team of 5+ writers (your responsibility, not ours)

- Writer onboarding and replacement

- Daily and weekly content delivery

- Meeting monthly word targets

- Ensuring content is NOT AI-generated or generic



You will NOT:

- Write articles yourself

- Ask us to hire writers

- Ask us to manage day-to-day tasks





==================================================

CONTENT TYPE

==================================================



- Long-form articles (1,500â€“3,000 words)

- Practical, experience-based content

- Pain-killer content that removes confusion

- Not fluff, definitions, or AI-style writing



We provide:

- Detailed outlines

- Editorial direction

- Feedback from a senior editor





==================================================

REQUIREMENTS (MANDATORY)

==================================================



You MUST meet ALL of the following:

- Currently or previously managed at least 5 writers

- Delivered 200,000+ words per month before

- Understand how to enforce quality at scale

- Can replace writers quickly if quality drops

- Comfortable owning delivery end-to-end

- Want a long-term role (6â€“12 months minimum)



If you cannot meet ALL of the above, do NOT apply.





==================================================

COMPENSATION

==================================================



- Fixed monthly pay (not per article or per word)

- Stable, long-term engagement



Compensation depends on demonstrated capacity and quality. You are expected to manage writer payments within your own structure.





==================================================

TRIAL / VALIDATION

==================================================



Before full onboarding:

- Short paid pilot

- Small batch of articles

- Quality reviewed by our editor



If quality and delivery are strong, we scale immediately.





==================================================

APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS (IMPORTANT)

==================================================



To apply, reply with ALL of the following:



1. How many writers do you currently manage?

2. What niches have your teams written in?

3. Maximum monthly word volume you can reliably deliver

4. How you ensure writers do NOT use AI

5. One example of content your team produced (editor-approved)



Applications that do not answer ALL 5 questions will be rejected without response.





==================================================

FINAL NOTE

==================================================



This role is for someone who wants to OWN a system, not do tasks. If you are looking for stability, long-term work, and responsibility, this will be a good fit.

title: Social Media Content Creator  + Operations Support ( Travel & Sports )
description:
Event Escapes is an AI-Powered Travel Startup based in Australia. We sell high-end travel packages for the worldâ€™s biggest events: Formula 1, Premier League, NBA, and Taylor Swift. etc.



We are looking for a Creative Producer who can take our travel packages and turn them into viral, high-converting content for Instagram Reels and TikTok plus handle VIP customer support and operations. 



HOURS: 20 Hours / Week (Flexible Schedule)

LOCATION: Remote (Work from Home) 

CAREER PATH: Potential to upgrade to Full-Time (40hrs/week) after a 4-month performance review.



YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES (60% Content / 40% Operations)



1. SOCIAL MEDIA & CONTENT (60% - The Growth Engine):



Video Production: You edit 3-5 high-quality Reels/TikToks per week. You are an expert in CapCut and know how to use trending audio, hooks, and fast-paced editing to grab attention.



Content Strategy: You research upcoming events (e.g., "Monaco GP 2026") and create a content calendar to promote them before they sell out.



Aesthetic & Brand: You use Canva to create professional Instagram Stories and Carousels that look like a premium luxury travel brand.



Community Growth: You reply to comments, engage with travel communities, and build hype around our brand.



2. OPERATIONS & SUPPORT (40% - The Safety Net):



Emergency Booking Support: You are the first line of defense for customers in trouble. If a guest has an issue at hotel check-in or with their tickets, you resolve it immediately via WhatsApp,
, or Live Chat.



VIP Concierge: We sell packages worth $5,000+. You manage our Support Inbox with flawless, professional, and empathetic English.



Flexible On-Call: You generally work weekdays, but we may need you to be on-call during major events to handle urgent questions if they arise.



MANDATORY TECH REQUIREMENTS:



Own Device: You must have your own fast Laptop or PC capable of editing video without lagging. (We do not provide equipment).



Internet: High-speed connection is required for uploading large video files and streaming sports.



Backup Plan: You must have a backup internet source (e.g., Mobile Data Hotspot) in case of outages.



WHO YOU ARE:



A Visual Storyteller: You have a portfolio of travel or lifestyle content that looks expensive and professional.



Tech-Savvy: You are comfortable using AI tools (ChatGPT/Claude), Admin Dashboards, and Google Sheets.



Sports/Event Knowledge: You know the difference between the NBA Finals and the Super Bowl.



? DO NOT APPLY IF:



You have no video editing portfolio.



You are afraid to speak up and solve problems.



You cannot handle a fast-paced startup environment.



HOW TO APPLY (Required)

We ignore generic applications. Please complete these 2 steps:



1. The Portfolio: Share a Google Drive link to 3 Short-Form Videos (Reels/TikToks) you have edited. (Travel or Sports content is a bonus).



2. The "Crisis" Test: A customer DMs us on Saturday night: "I arrived at the hotel but they can't find my booking! Help me immediately!"



Write your exact reply to the customer to calm them down and explain that you are checking the system.



Subject Line: "Content & Ops - [Your Name]"

title: Finance / Accounting Manager - E-commerce
description:
Job Type: Full-time / Part-time



About the Company:



We are a growing e-commerce social enterprise that sells handcrafted bracelets to fund feeding operations for abandoned dogs worldwide. We operate 100+ feeding locations globally and have fed over 350,000 dogs since 2020.



Job Overview:

We're looking for an experienced Finance Manager to take full ownership of our financial tracking and reporting. You will be responsible for creating comprehensive financial oversight sheets and maintaining accurate records of all business finances across our e-commerce operations.

Key Responsibilities:



Create and maintain detailed financial tracking sheets for complete business oversight

Track and reconcile all revenue streams (e-commerce sales, subscriptions, donations)

Monitor and report on ad spend across all marketing channels 
, Google, etc.)

Calculate and track COGS (Cost of Goods Sold) for all products

Track and manage refunds, chargebacks, and payment disputes

Create monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports

Monitor cash flow and maintain accurate P&L statements

Track expenses across multiple categories (production, shipping, operations, team, etc.)

Reconcile transactions from multiple platforms (Shopify, payment processors, etc.)

Manage multi-currency transactions and international vendor payments

Maintain organized financial records and documentation

Prepare financial summaries and dashboards for leadership review



Required Skills & Experience:



MUST HAVE: Prior experience in e-commerce finance management

Expert-level proficiency in Google Sheets and/or Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, formulas, VLOOKUP, financial modeling)

Strong experience creating financial tracking systems and comprehensive oversight sheets

Experience tracking ad spend, ROAS, and marketing budgets

Understanding of e-commerce metrics: COGS, refund rates, chargeback management, profit margins

Experience with Shopify or similar e-commerce platforms

Familiarity with payment processors (Stripe, PayPal, etc.)

High attention to detail and accuracy with numbers

Excellent organizational skills

Strong communication skills in English (written and verbal)

Self-motivated and able to work independently

Reliable internet connection and professional work setup



Preferred Qualifications:



Experience with accounting software (QuickBooks, Xero, Wave, or similar)

Experience managing subscription-based business finances

Knowledge of multi-currency transactions

Experience with
 Ads Manager and Google Ads financial reporting

Previous work with international e-commerce businesses



What You'll Be Working With:



Shopify store

 Ads, Google Ads

Multiple payment processors

International vendors and suppliers

Subscription management systems

Multi-currency transactions



Important Notes:



This role focuses on financial tracking and reporting ONLY

You will NOT be required to provide financial advice or strategic recommendations

You will create the sheets and systems; we handle the strategic decisions



What We're Looking For:

Someone who is obsessed with accuracy, loves working with numbers and spreadsheets, and can build comprehensive financial tracking systems from the ground up. You should be comfortable managing multiple data sources and creating clear, organized reports.

To Apply:

Please submit:



Your updated resume/CV

Brief description of your e-commerce finance experience

Examples of financial tracking sheets or systems you've created (screenshots or samples)

Your availability and expected salary



Application Questions:



How many years of experience do you have in e-commerce finance?

What e-commerce platforms have you worked with?

What tools/software do you use for financial tracking?

Can you provide an example of a complex financial sheet you've built?

title: Personal Virtual Assistant -- Organized, Proactive, AI-Friendly
description:
## Job Title



Personal Virtual Assistant -- Organized, Proactive, AI-Friendly



## Job Description



I'm a tech entrepreneur running multiple projects (a software company, investments, and a DJ side business). I'm looking for a sharp, organized virtual assistant to be my right hand on the operations side of things.



This isn't a typical VA role. **You'll essentially be my number two** -- helping me run things, not just checking off tasks. I need someone who takes ownership, builds systems, thinks strategically, and holds me accountable. If I'm dragging my feet on something, I expect you to follow up and push me to get it done. If you're someone who waits quietly for the next task, this isn't the right fit.



### What You'll Be Doing



- **Document & file organization** -- Organizing Google Drive, cloud storage, and local files. Building folder structures and naming conventions. Proactively thinking about ways to improve our efficiency and readiness for taxes and other document-heavy events -- not just organizing once, but creating systems that stay organized.

- **Personal admin & gifting** -- Researching and ordering gifts for friends, family, and business contacts. Handling purchases and managing recurring personal tasks that keep falling through the cracks.

- **Travel booking & points optimization** -- Booking travel, tracking my points balances across programs, and recommending the best way to use them for each trip. Proactively flagging deals and redemption opportunities.

- **Calendar & scheduling** -- Coordinating meetings, blocking focus time, keeping me on track.

- **Sales operations & client support** -- I handle the selling, but you help close the loop. Sending out DocuSigns, following up with clients, preparing contracts and consulting agreements, and handling the admin side of closing deals.

- **Copywriting** -- Drafting copy for consulting proposals, client-facing
s, social media posts, and other communications as needed.

- **Product & market research** -- Researching competitors, market positioning, and user needs for new applications I'm building. You'll be my thought partner on this, not just a data gatherer.

- **AI tools & marketing research** -- Staying on top of new AI tools and marketing strategies. Identifying what we should be using and how to implement them.

- **Content summarization** -- Summarizing articles, reports, and content I haven't had time to read. We'll build an AI-assisted workflow for this together.



### What Makes You Stand Out



**You're a systematizer.** The first time you do something, you document it. You create SOPs, checklists, and templates so it never has to be figured out twice. You think in systems, not one-off tasks.



**You're proactive and direct.** You don't wait to be told what to do next. You see what needs doing and you flag it. You're comfortable being frank with me -- if something is falling behind, you say so.



**You're organized and trustworthy.** You manage details without dropping balls. You handle sensitive information (finances, personal accounts) with discretion.



**You can think independently.** When I give you a goal, you figure out the steps. You don't need every decision made for you.



### Required Skills



- Strong English communication (written and verbal)

- Google Workspace (Drive, Docs, Sheets, Calendar)

- Notion (or similar project management/knowledge base tools)

- Comfortable with video calls and async communication



### Nice to Have



- Experience with AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, etc.) -- I'm happy to teach this if you're a fast learner

- Ability to set up Slack integrations and automations

- Experience with travel booking and points/miles optimization

- Previous experience as a personal or executive assistant

- Bookkeeping or basic financial organization experience



### Schedule & Compensation



- **Starting at 10 hours/week** with the opportunity to scale to full-time as we build trust and the workload grows

- **$300/month retainer** to start

- Flexible hours -- I care about output, not when you're online

- Long-term role -- I'm looking for someone to grow with, not a short-term hire



### How to Apply



Please include in your application:



1. A brief intro about yourself and your experience as a VA

2. Tell me about a time you created a system or process that made your client's life easier

3. What AI tools do you currently use, if any? (It's okay if the answer is none -- I value honesty over a padded resume)

4. Your availability and preferred working hours



I'll be doing a 30-minute video interview with shortlisted candidates, followed by a small paid test task so we can both see if the fit is right.

title: Freelance Shopify Developer (Ongoing Support Partner)
description:
We are looking for a reliable, experienced freelance Shopify developer to support our e-commerce store on an ongoing, as-needed basis.



This is a long-term working relationship, not a full-time hire. We want to build a trusted partnership with one or two developers we can consistently rely on for website improvements, troubleshooting, and custom development work.



Remote candidates are preferred.



About the Role



We regularly need technical Shopify support for tasks that go beyond what our internal team can complete, including:



Theme edits and customizations



Coding support and bug fixing



App integrations and troubleshooting



Performance improvements and technical clean-up



Rather than working with agencies or rotating freelancers, we want a dependable developer who understands our store over time and can provide consistent support when needed.

description:

You will be making TikTok videos using Capcup or the video editing software of your choice. The editing process is fairly simple and straightforward. Anyone who is proficient in video editing should have no problem with the basic tasks such as:

- Cutting dead space in talking head videos

- Adding overlay images on screen in the videos

- Minor effects such as dynamic zoom, cropping, etc.

- Producing b-roll content from voiceover and footage provided, having the ability to digest what is being said and pair up the audio with corresponding footage



Please review a few examples of my content to ensure you are familiar and comfortable with the editing style:

1. Basic talking head - here you are mostly editing dead space and piecing clips together, adding minor effects like crop and zoom to make the frames look more dynamic and seamless.







2. Talking head with overlays - same as before, but adding images provided to you on the screen to support what is being said in the video.







3. B-roll content - you will be provided a voice over and need to work through the footage to find fitting visuals. A strong understanding of English and social media content is crucial here.







You will be working hand in hand with me on an extremely viral social media page and there is room for bonuses if deadlines are met and the content performs well!



Requirements:

- Attention to detail

- STRONG English

- Strong internet connection

- Previous experience with Capcut / TikTok / Instagram

- Good working with a team

- Ability to learn and take constructive feedback

- Availability to work 2-3h a day (with potential for more and increased salary)

- Able to work 5-6 days per week (can take days off whenever as long as mostly consistent)

- Can take payments through Wise

- PH or similar time zone



$300/month + bonuses for 2-3h a day MAX and potential full time work in the future with a salary increase.



To apply, please complete the recreate assignment below so I can see your skills (1h max)



Below is a Google drive with the original files you will need to re-create this reference video:



Reference video: 



Google drive: 



Please complete the following steps: (this was for a b-roll style video)

1. Download the files and import into your video editing software

2. Find the â€œgoodâ€ takes of the audio sections and stitch together to complete the voiceover

3. Find the corresponding footage to match what is being said in the voiceover

4. Pay close attention to detail in the selection of the clips, the pacing (duration of each scene), cropping, etc.

5. Message me with a link to the re-created video

title: Detail-Obsessed QA engineer for World Class Shopify Builds
description:
BTF â€” Premium Ecommerce CRO & Design Agency



This is not a standard QA role.



You are not here to check if everything works.

You are not here to say â€œlooks fine.â€

You are here to make sure everything that ships is world-class.



QA at BTF is standards control. Our standards are the business.



If something goes live and it isnâ€™t at the level we expect, QA failed.

Not dev. Not design. QA.



If you approve a build, you are personally vouching that it meets our standard.

If it doesnâ€™t feel like something a top-tier brand would ship, it does not go live.



You are the final gate before launch.



About Us



Weâ€™re a high-end ecommerce CRO and design agency building and optimizing Shopify stores for serious brands.

We focus on premium execution; tight design, strong copy, clean dev, and obsessive attention to detail.



Weâ€™re not trying to be average.

Weâ€™re trying to ship some of the cleanest ecommerce experiences in the space.



This role exists to protect that.



Youâ€™ll be involved in shipping high-standard builds and iterations for growing ecommerce brands; and youâ€™ll have real authority over what goes live.



Core Mandate



Your job is to find imperfections.



Not obvious ones.

Small ones.

Microscopic ones.



The kind most people would ignore.



You are expected to notice:



1px spacing inconsistencies



alignment that feels slightly off



hover states that arenâ€™t fully polished



animation timing that feels cheap



responsiveness issues at edge breakpoints



cross-browser rendering differences



small UX friction points



These are not nitpicks here.

This is the job.



If a detail feels almost ridiculous to flag, thatâ€™s usually exactly the level of attention we expect.



If you cannot find issues, you are not looking hard enough.



â€œAll goodâ€ is not an acceptable QA outcome.



What Youâ€™ll Be Doing



Youâ€™ll be QAâ€™ing:



Shopify storefronts



landing pages and PDPs



new features and site iterations



CRO tests and experiments



design/dev handoffs before launch



You will:



compare builds against Figma



check responsiveness across devices



test interactions and states



identify visual inconsistencies



catch regressions when new features are added



document issues clearly with screenshots or Looms



hold builds until everything is resolved



Often we are adding new features to existing live stores.

That means your job isnâ€™t just checking whatâ€™s new; itâ€™s ensuring nothing else broke in the process.



If something regresses anywhere on the site, you catch it.



How You Work



You naturally:



zoom in on everything



resize constantly



test edge cases



check across browsers



question polish



assume something is wrong until proven otherwise



Youâ€™re comfortable being the person who says:

â€œNot ready yet.â€



You donâ€™t approve builds lightly.

You take ownership seriously.



Who This Role Is For



Someone who:



is extremely detail-oriented



has high taste for design and polish



notices tiny inconsistencies instantly



enjoys spotting what others miss



takes pride in precision



wants to be part of shipping top-tier work



You donâ€™t need to come from a big agency.

But you do need a sharp eye and high standards.



Experience with Shopify or ecommerce QA is a plus; but obsessive attention to detail matters more.



Who This Is Not For



This will not work if you:



rush checks



only look for obvious bugs



are comfortable shipping â€œmostly fineâ€



donâ€™t care about micro-details



want a passive checklist role



This is an ownership role.



Authority



QA has final sign-off before launch.



If you flag issues and they arenâ€™t resolved, the build does not ship.

You are trusted to protect the standard.



To Apply



Send:



A short intro



Any relevant QA or review experience



A Loom where you QA any e-commerce site and list every issue you can find



Weâ€™re looking for someone who naturally sees what others miss and wants to be part of shipping very high-quality work.



If thatâ€™s you, apply.

title: Amazon Product Researcher
description:
Urgent Hiring: Amazon Product Researcher (Toys Category)

Reports To: CEO

Work Hours: Philippines daytime work hours



ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.



Company Vision:

We want to work with you to grow our company while helping you to become a superstar in your field. We value problem solvers, go getters, people with opinions who want to make an impact. You will be on the leading edge of Amazon and online strategies and will be continually improving your knowledge in the pursuit of helping us grow our business.

At the same time, you will be working with a company that values community & family in both our internal and customer facing sides. Our mission is to delight kids & parents with creative craft kits and related products. We are 100% focused on that mission and want you to be there on the ride with us!

Thatâ€™s where you come in as our next Amazon Fee & Unit Economics Management Accountant



Role Purpose

The Amazon Product Researcher plays a critical role in driving new product innovation and continuous product improvement for our toy brand. This role exists to support the CEO by delivering clear, data-backed insights on what products to launch next and how to improve existing products, using deep competitive research on Amazon.



This person is obsessed with understanding toy trends, customer behavior, and competitive gaps. Through systematic research of Amazon listings, reviews, pricing, features, and emerging trends, the Product Researcher helps ensure that every product decision is grounded in real market demand and customer feedback.



What Success Looks Like:

Success in the Amazon Product Researcher role means the CEO always has clear, confident direction on what products to launch and how to improve existing ones. A successful researcher consistently surfaces high-potential toy opportunities before competitors, supported by strong data around demand, competition, pricing, and differentiation. Their research eliminates guesswork and replaces it with clarity.



Additionally, success is reflected in the continuous improvement of current products. By analyzing customer reviews across our listings and competitorsâ€™, this role identifies recurring pain points, unmet needs, and feature gaps that directly inform product upgrades. Over time, these insights lead to stronger reviews, fewer recurring complaints, and products that stand out clearly in crowded Amazon toy categories.



Primary Objectives

â€¢ Research Amazon toy market trends and emerging product opportunities

â€¢ Analyze competitor products to identify gaps, weaknesses, and differentiation opportunities

â€¢ Review and synthesize customer feedback to guide product improvements

â€¢ Prepare structured research reports to support CEO decision-making



Regular Work Activities

â€¢ Monitor Amazon toy category best sellers, new releases, and movers

â€¢ Analyze top competitor listings (features, pricing, images, positioning)

â€¢ Track emerging toy trends by age group, theme, and seasonality

â€¢ Perform deep review mining on competitor and internal products

â€¢ Identify recurring customer complaints and unmet needs

â€¢ Summarize review sentiment into clear improvement recommendations

â€¢ Research potential product variations, bundles, or line extensions

â€¢ Evaluate demand, competition level, and differentiation potential

â€¢ Create clear research briefs for new product ideas

â€¢ Maintain a database of researched products and insights

â€¢ Support CEO with ad hoc product research requests

â€¢ Compare pricing strategies and perceived value across competitors

â€¢ Identify opportunities to improve safety, durability, or play value

â€¢ Highlight trends related to gifting, education, and seasonal demand

â€¢ Present findings in simple, actionable formats (slides or docs)

â€¢ Track historical trends to validate long-term opportunity strength



Key Skills Required

â€¢ Strong analytical and critical thinking skills

â€¢ Deep curiosity about toys, trends, and customer behavior

â€¢ Strong attention to detail

â€¢ Strong spreadsheet skills

â€¢ Clear written communication and reporting skills

â€¢ Pattern recognition and trend analysis

â€¢ Independent problem-solving mindset

â€¢ Data-driven decision making

â€¢ Growth-oriented and improvement-focused



People Contacts and Interactions

â€¢ Direct report to the CEO

â€¢ Frequent communication with

â€¢ Operations Team

â€¢ China Based Production Team



Role Requirements

Experience, Training, and Education

â€¢ Familiarity with Amazon listings, categories, and ranking dynamics

â€¢ Experience analyzing customer reviews for insights

â€¢ Strong Excel or Google Sheets skills

â€¢ Comfort working with qualitative and quantitative data

â€¢ E-commerce or Amazon private label experience preferred

â€¢ Experience in toys or consumer products is a plus

â€¢ Ability to work independently with minimal oversight

â€¢ High level of personal accountability

â€¢ Proven ability to turn research into actionable recommendations



How to Apply:

Click the link -
