title: Senior Short-Form Video Editor
description:
Job Role: Senior Short-Form Video Editor

Compensation range: $1800 - $2200 AUD / Monthly. This could be done via EOR (employer of record) or independent contractor agreement depending on the terms we agree upon.



**Note: While we are looking to fill a full-time role as the primary objective, we are also looking for contract/freelance video editors as well to assist with overflow work as well. Please state which applies to you in your application.



Work Schedule: This role is expected to align with the AU business hours (approx. 9 AM - 5 PM, Monday to Friday) for collaboration, but as a contractor, youâ€™ll have flexibility in how you manage your time.



We are looking for an experience short-form video editor to join our team. You will be working closely with our Social Media Management team to produce high quality, short form reels which engage, educate, entertain and inspire.



A deep understanding of social media content, pacing, hooks and retention techniques as well as overall creativity will be paramount in this role. You will need to be able to follow a brief and client guidelines as well as know when it's ok to do something a little different in order to get the best results.



You will also be somewhat of a "Creative Director" in that we will also be relying on you to set the standards for creativity for each client, by understanding their brand and seeing it as what it could be and provide new ideas.



Please see some examples of the type of work we do and what you will be working on: 



A bit about us: 



A dynamic creative marketing agency located in Brisbane, that focuses on crafting compelling content, producing videos, managing social media, and developing brand strategies to help businesses communicate their message. Built on the idea that thoughtful storytelling creates real impact, the team emphasizes creativity, innovation, and a collaborative, supportive workplace culture.



Role Overview: 



We're looking for a Senior Short-Form Video Editor to join this Brisbane-based creative agency specialising in content creation and social media management for B2B and service-based businesses.



In this role, you'll transform raw footage into scroll-stopping Instagram Reels, TikToks, YouTube Shorts, and LinkedIn videos. You'll work across multiple client brands, delivering high-volume, high-quality content that drives real engagement and results.



You'll report to the Social Media Manager and collaborate closely with our Social Media Coordinator, Senior Video Editor, and Videographer. We provide all software, storage, and systems â€” you bring the talent and your own editing workstation.



What Success Looks Like:



Consistently producing platform-native video content that looks like it belongs on each client's feed â€” not like it came from a template factory. You nail the hook in the first 3 seconds, maintain energy throughout, and deliver clean endings that leave viewers satisfied.



You hit deadlines reliably, flag issues early, and require minimal revisions because you've internalised each client's brand guidelines. Your 18th video of the week looks as sharp as your 1st.



This role suits editors who bring creative flair while thriving within defined processes. You're not just executing â€” you're injecting energy, personality, and storytelling craft into every edit.



What You'll Do:



- Edit short-form videos (30-90 seconds) from raw footage including podcasts, interviews, events, and B2B content

- Apply retention editing techniques: pattern interrupts, dynamic pacing, strategic zooms, visual hooks

- Create burnt-in captions with accurate timing, spelling, and brand-consistent styling

- Build motion graphics elements: lower thirds, callouts, kinetic text, animated transitions

- Export multiple versions per video (9:16, 1:1, 4:5) and custom thumbnails as required

- Maintain brand consistency across high-volume batch production

- Follow established workflows using ClickUp (project management) and Dropbox (footage & review)



Requirements:



- 3+ years professional video editing experience

- Expert proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro and/or DaVinci Resolve

- Strong proficiency in Adobe After Effects

- Intermediate to expert motion graphics skills (lower thirds, kinetic text, animated elements)

- Proven portfolio showcasing short-form social video content (Reels, TikToks, Shorts)

- Strong understanding of retention editing and platform-specific pacing

- Caption creation expertise with excellent spelling and grammar

- Audio editing fundamentals (levels, EQ, noise reduction)

- Basic colour correction skills

- Excellent written and spoken English

- Own workstation suitable for video editing (multi-core processor, 16GB+ RAM, dedicated GPU, SSD storage)

- Reliable high-speed internet connection



Nice to Have:



-Advanced colour grading capabilities



What We Offer:



- Full-time, stable position with an established creative agency

- All software provided (Adobe Creative Cloud, DaVinci Resolve, etc.)

- Storage drives provided - Initially we will need you to provide your own hard drives etc however long term we would deliver you a NAS.

- Work across diverse client brands in property, professional services, hospitality, trades, allied health and more

- Clear processes and brand guidelines â€” no guesswork

- Supportive team environment with weekly check-ins



Work Arrangement & Expectations:



- This is a remote role that will be set up via an Employer of Record (EOR) service.

- To ensure alignment and transparency, successful candidates will be expected to:



- Be available for meetings and collaboration during core [AEST] business hours

- Disclose any existing ongoing roles or client work

- Reflect this engagement on their LinkedIn profile

title: Pixel Artist - Military Strategy Game Assets
description:
Create a complete, cohesive pixel art asset pack for "Soldiers of Wealth" - a turn-based strategy game combining military tactics with financial markets. Need professional-quality assets that avoid placeholder aesthetics and maintain visual consistency across all game elements.



Art Style Requirements



Pixel Art: 16x16 to 64x64 sprites, clean pixel-perfect artwork

Aesthetic: Military command center meets Wall Street trading floor

Palette: Professional color scheme with military blues, gold accents, financial greens/reds

Consistency: Unified style across all assets (same resolution, outline style, lighting)



Required Asset List

Characters (15-20 assets)



1 Player commander sprite (idle animation, 4 frames)

6 Bot commander portraits (static busts, 48x48px)

1 Generic soldier sprite (walk cycle, 4 frames)

Soldier recolors for different factions (6 variants)



UI Elements (25-30 assets)



Button states: normal/hover/pressed/disabled (4 variants)

Panel frames and card backgrounds

Market icons: stocks/real estate/crypto/business (4 icons)

Status icons: soldiers, week counter, economy states (8 icons)

Progress bars and sliders



Backgrounds (3-4 assets)



Main battlefield scene (1280x720 base resolution)

Economy state variants (tinted overlays for boom/stable/downturn/crisis)

Optional: Command center interior background



Effects & Animations (10-15 assets)



Number pop-ups (+50 soldiers, profit/loss indicators)

Simple particle effects for market activities

Loading/processing animations

Transition effects between screens



Technical Specifications



Resolution: Scalable pixel art (base 16px grid)

Format: PNG with transparency

Naming: Consistent file naming convention

Organization: Organized folder structure by category

Atlas Ready: Spritesheets for Animations and UI elements



What We Provide



Screen mockups and layout references

Asset naming and organization requirements



Required Skills



3+ years pixel art experience

Game asset creation portfolio

UI design for games or applications

Character design and animation

Asset optimization and technical delivery



Preferred Experience



Strategy game asset creation

Military/tactical game aesthetics

Financial/business app UI design

Steam game asset experience

Sprite animation and effects



Portfolio Requirements

Please provide examples of:



Complete game asset packages you've created

UI element libraries with consistent theming

Character sprites with animations

Pixel art style range showing versatility within constraints

title: Unlock Your Creativity: Join Arispheris as a Graphic Designer for a Dynamic 3-Month Project
description:
Arispheris is looking for a highly skilled and innovative Graphic Designer to join our team for a 3-month full-time project term, with potential for extension. This is a remote position, but we require a designer who can work independently, take initiative, and bring fresh, original creativity to the tableâ€”no AI-generated designs will be accepted.



If you thrive in an environment that values creative autonomy, attention to detail, and hands-on design skills, weâ€™d love to hear from you.



Company Overview

Arispheris is a staffing firm that provides authentic and connective staffing solutions for small business owners. We take pride in our in-depth recruiting process, ensuring that every professional we bring on board has the skills and drive to succeed.



We are actively expanding our design team and are looking for a Graphic Designer who excels at crafting compelling visuals that enhance brand presence and engage audiences. If you want to be part of a team that values true creative expertise, this is the perfect opportunity for you!



Key Responsibilities

Design on-brand graphics for both Arispheris and its clients, including but not limited to:

Logos, brand kits, media and promo materials

Social media banners, headers, and marketing posts

Website vector images, multimedia thumbnails, and digital ads

 marketing templates

Ensure all final graphics are visually appealing, 100% original (no AI-generated work), and meet client brand guidelines.

Collaborate with tea
mbers and clients to conceptualize social media campaigns and marketing materials.

Present design drafts, revise based on feedback, and ensure timely project completion.

Keep a well-organized directory of design assets for efficient access.

Stay up to date with design trends and continuously refine skills to maintain top-tier creative output.



Requirements & Qualifications

A degree in Graphic Design, Digital Arts, Creative Multimedia, Marketing, or a related field.

At least 2 years of professional experience in digital design, branding, or marketing.

Must be highly proficient in both Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop) and Canvaâ€”you will be tested during the interview.

Strong sense of design composition, color theory, and typography.

Ability to create content quickly and efficiently while maintaining a high standard of design quality.

Excellent communication skills and ability to work collaboratively with clients and teams.

Detail-oriented and capable of handling multiple projects at once while meeting deadlines.

Familiarity with tools like Google Workspace, Slack, and Asana is a plus.

Absolutely no AI-generated designs or portfolios will be considered.



Compensation & Benefits

Full-time remote position (3-month term, potential for extension based on performance)

Competitive compensation based on experience and skills

Bi-monthly pay via money transfer

Paid career training relevant to the role

Performance-based bonuses

Work-life balance and flexible hours



How to Apply

We will be holding interviews on Wednesday, Thursday, and Friday this week for immediate hiring, contingent on your skills and company fit.



To Apply, Follow These Steps:

Reply with your Name and Position in the subject line. Example: "John Doe â€“ Graphic Designer"

Define a staging area (this is part of your application process).



Submit the following:

Your resume (CV)

Portfolio links showcasing your original design work (no AI-generated content)

Websites you have designed (if applicable)



Once we receive your application, we will send you a scheduler to book your interview slot. You will be required to demonstrate proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite and Canva during the interview.



If youâ€™re ready to bring your creativity to a team that values real design expertise, we look forward to your application!

title: SHORT FORM VIDEO EDITOR | Flexible Work Schedule
description:
Weâ€™re hiring someone who knows how to turn long-form content into sharp, high-retention short videos for platforms like TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts.



This role is for someone who understands pacing, hooks, and visual rhythm in short-form content, and knows how to edit with intention rather than just cutting clips.



â€”-----------------------------------------------------------------------------



READ THE ENTIRE JOB LISTING CAREFULLY. The final step of the hiring process will require the candidate to provide at least 1 former employer/team lead reference and at least 1 character reference. These will be verified prior to extending an offer.



--- ABOUT THE TEAM ---

Want to work in a rewarding, fast-paced, start-up atmosphere? Looking for significant growth and performance bonus opportunities? Have a growth mindset, value relationships, and dedicated to getting results? Then we might be a fit!



What is it like to work with us? HEAR FROM OUR TEAM!   





Our Core Values:

1) DELIGHT THE CLIENT:  We consistently exceed expectations by anticipating needs, delivering outstanding service, and creating those â€œmagic 
ntsâ€ where every client feels seen and heard.

2) MASTER YOUR CRAFT:  We commit to continuous learning, share our expertise openly, and tackle every challenge with precision and a deep sense of duty.

3) FOLLOW THROUGH, ALWAYS:  When we say something will happen, it doesâ€”every time. We own every task, ensuring that nothing falls through the cracks, and when mistakes occur, we learn and improve immediately.



Our core values are important and the right candidate will share our values. We are building an awesome place to work, not just cutting together videos for our real estate business.



--- ABOUT YOU ---

Do you have strong creative instincts and know how to spot 
nts that make people stop scrolling? Are you proactive, adaptable, and detail-oriented? Do you have a sharp sense of pacing, an instinct for hooks, and a clear understanding of how short-form videos need to flow to hold attention? Do you take pride in clean edits and delivering videos that feel intentional and finished? Do our core values sound like a fit for who you are?



Then keep reading to see if we're a fit!



Responsibilities:

Short-Form Editing & Story Selection

- Review long-form videos, transcripts, or raw footage to identify short-form clip opportunities

- Select 
nts that are clear, engaging, and platform-appropriate

- Edit vertical videos optimized for TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts

- Create strong hooks, clean cuts, and natural pacing

- Deliver publish-ready videos that meet brand and platform standards



Captions, Visuals & Formatting

- Add on-screen captions (burned-in or SRT as required) with proper timing and readability

- Apply basic motion, zooms, punch-ins, and visual emphasis where appropriate

- Follow platform-specific formatting (aspect ratio, duration, safe margins)



Iteration & Workflow

- Implement feedback efficiently and meet agreed turnaround times

- Maintain clear file naming and folder organization

- Track edits, revisions, and delivery status as required



Requirements:

- A STABLE, HIGH-SPEED INTERNET CONNECTION, REQUIRED (at least 150mbps)

- Experience with Final Cut Pro X (or other editing software, such as Adobe After Effects and Premiere Pro) is required

- Strong preference for MacOS users

- Experience editing short-form vertical content for social platforms, required

- Strong understanding of short-form pacing, hooks, and retention

- Experience working from transcripts or long-form content, required

- Clean file organization and understanding of post-production workflo

- Portfolio of completed short-form video projects, required

- General understanding of brand, content marketing, YouTube, etc, required

- GREAT interpersonal and communication skills, required

- Ability to self-start, work on a tight schedule, and manage multiple project deadlines, required

- Ability to follow directions and a LOVE of completing lots of projects according to consistent specifications, required

- Growth mindset, required



--- APPLICATION & RECRUITMENT PROCESS ---

STEP 1:

Fill out the application form through the link below and write "green kangaroo" in the Additional Comments field.


 



STEP 2:

Qualified candidates may be invited to participate in two PAID test projects, $10-20 USD for each test project estimated to be 2-3hrs of work for each (a total of $40 USD!).



STEP 3:

Candidates who advance through the test project rounds will be invited to an interview.



STEP 4:

Before extending a trial offer, we will conduct a CHARACTER REFERENCE CHECK for the final candidate(s). CONDUCTING A REFERENCE CHECK will be the last step in the hiring process.



STEP 5:

Upon receiving a trial offer, you will be onboarded as a Video Editor with a 90-day PAID trial period. During this period, we expect you to demonstrate your video editing expertise, meet project deadlines, be a team player, and excel at what you do. A successful trial will lead to a permanent offer to join the team.

description:
Role Type: Contract / Freelance

title: Part-Time Bookkeeper + Cash Flow / Finance Manager (Remote)
description:
TITLE:

Part-Time Bookkeeper + Cash Flow / Finance Manager (QuickBooks Online) - Remote



HOURS:

Part-time to start (20-25 hrs/week), with opportunity to grow into full-time

Must overlap 2-3 hours with Vancouver, Canada (PST)



START:

ASAP



PAY:

Competitive and based on experience. We pay for quality.



ABOUT US:

We are a Vancouver, Canada-based high-end residential construction supplier and installer (project-based). We work on luxury custom homes and manage large project invoices, deposits, progress payments, and job costs.



This is a serious role. We are not looking for a generic VA. We are looking for a real accounting professional who can take ownership of our bookkeeping and help manage the overall financial health of the company.



We are looking for someone long-term. If you are looking for short-term work, freelancing, or multiple clients, this role is not a good fit. We want someone who will become part of the company for years, grow with us, and be treated like part of the team.



ROLE SUMMARY:

You will be responsible for keeping our accounting clean and accurate in QuickBooks Online, ensuring reconciliations are done properly, tracking job profitability, and maintaining cash flow visibility for the owner.



Our transaction volume is not huge, but our invoices are large and accuracy is extremely important.



RESPONSIBILITIES:

QuickBooks Online bookkeeping and cleanup.

Bank and credit card reconciliations.

Accounts payable and accounts receivable.

Transaction categorization and proper coding.

Maintaining a clean chart of accounts and organized records.

Tracking income and costs by job/project (job costing).

Tracking deposits and progress payments correctly.

Monitoring job profitability while projects are active.

Maintaining a cash flow statement and identifying cash flow risks early.

Providing a simple monthly financial health summary to the owner.

Monthly reporting including Profit and Loss, Balance Sheet, AR Aging, cash summary, and basic job margin snapshot.

Preparing clean year-end records for our external accountant.

Supporting GST/PST preparation (Canada). Guidance will be provided.



REQUIREMENTS (STRICT):

Strong QuickBooks Online experience.

Strong reconciliation skills.

Month-end close experience.

Experience preparing financial reports.

Strong English communication (written and spoken).

High attention to detail and strong follow-through.

Professionalism and confidentiality.



PREFERRED (STRONGLY):

Construction or project-based accounting experience.

Job costing experience.

Audit, controller, or accounting manager experience.

Buildertrend or similar software experience



BENEFITS:

Long-term stable role.

Part-time to start with growth to full-time.

Two weeks paid vacation per year (once full-time).

Respectful, professional working environment.

Clear expectations and communication.



IMPORTANT: HOW TO APPLY (READ CAREFULLY)

Applications that do not follow instructions will be ignored. We are using this process to filter applicants who are serious and detail-oriented.



STEP 1:

Write this at the top of your application:

I READ THE INSTRUCTIONS



STEP 2:

Answer these questions in writing:



Explain step-by-step how you reconcile a bank account in QuickBooks Online.



How do you create and maintain a cash flow statement for a business?



Have you tracked profit per job/project before? If yes, explain how.



Expected salary for part-time (20-25 hrs/week) and full-time (40 hrs/week) in CAD.



What is one common mistake you see in QuickBooks files, and how do you fix it?



STEP 3:

Submit ONE short video (60-90 seconds):

In the video, include your name and current role.

Explain your QuickBooks experience.

Explain your month-end close process in checklist style.



Video can be Loom, Google Drive, or YouTube unlisted.



OPTIONAL BONUS:

Attach a screenshot of a bank reconciliation screen you personally completed in QuickBooks Online.

Blur all confidential information.



FINAL NOTE:

If your profile includes unrelated services such as social media, graphic design, video editing, or lead generation, we will assume accounting is not your main skill.

We are looking for an accounting professional who takes this role seriously.

title: Video Editor â€“ Aviation & Travel YouTube Channel
description:
We're looking for a skilled video editor to join the team behind a major aviation and travel YouTube channel with over 1 million subscribers. This is a full-time remote position with consistent, recurring work.



You'll be editing long-form YouTube videos covering airline reviews, hotel reviews, and aviation content. This includes working with multi-cam footage, narration, b-roll, and screen recordings, cutting to pace for strong audience retention, adding graphics, text overlays, and music, and managing file organization and project delivery on deadline.



Requirements: 

- Proficiency in Final Cut Pro (non-negotiable). 

- Demonstrated experience editing for other YouTube creators, ideally channels with 100K+ subscribers. 

- A genuine knowledge of aviation â€” you must be able to identify aircraft types (e.g., A350 vs. 787, A380 vs. 747) from footage. This will be tested during the interview. 

- Understanding of YouTube best practices including pacing, retention, and chapter structure. 

- Reliable communication and ability to meet deadlines across time zones.



Nice to have: 

- Interest in travel and airlines.

- Experience with motion graphics. 

- Familiarity with YouTube analytics and how editing choices affect retention.



To apply, send a brief intro about yourself and your aviation knowledge, links to 2â€“3 YouTube videos you've edited, and your availability.

title: AFFILIATE MANAGER
description:
AFFILIATE MANAGER



NordStick



NordStick is a leading fitness brand founded in 2020 by a prominent physical therapist, dedicated to innovative home based workout solutions that help people overcome pain, prevent injuries, and achieve peak performance. Our flagship products, like the NordStick and NordBench Pro, are affordable, high quality, and multifunctional, empowering over 250,000 customers to build strength and improve mobility without a gym. As part of a fast growing DTC fitness ecosystem, we're committed to making health and wellness accessible. This is not a lifestyle brand. It is a long term company with high expectations around execution, ownership, and reliability.



The Role



We are hiring an Affiliate Manager to own and scale NordStickâ€™s creator and affiliate partnerships.

This is not a passive â€œsend a few
s and hope someone postsâ€ role. You are responsible for building a real revenue channel through creators and partners.



You will identify the right people, reach out, close partnerships, manage deliverables, track performance, and make sure affiliates actually drive results.



If you need constant direction, this role will feel overwhelming. If you naturally spot opportunities, follow through, and treat outcomes like theyâ€™re your own business, you will thrive.



You will operate across marketing, ecommerce, and operations, working directly with the Founder and internal team to turn partnerships into consistent growth.



Core Responsibilities



1. Affiliate Strategy and Outreach

--> Lead creator research and qualification across Instagram,
, and YouTube, focusing on U.S. based influencers and affiliates who align with the brand

Â --> Manage outbound and inbound creator outreach and prospecting

Â --> Build and maintain a consistent pipeline of high quality partners

Â --> Draft and manage partnership agreements and contracts



2. Partner Onboarding and Execution

--> Own partner onboarding including whitelisting setup, expectations alignment, and launch timelines

Â --> Coordinate product seeding and create orders for affiliates

Â --> Track and manage creator deliverables throughout each phase of the campaign

Â --> Act as the primary point of contact for partners across the full lifecycle



3. Operations and Performance Management

--> Maintain and manage partnership workflows and tasks in Asana

Â --> Generate and analyze performance reports for affiliate campaigns

Â --> Track affiliate payouts and ensure timely and accurate compensation

Â --> Identify what is working, what is not, and proactively optimize for better results



What Success Looks Like



Within 30 Days

--> Active pipeline of qualified creators and affiliates

Â --> Outreach and onboarding systems clearly organized and repeatable

Â --> First partnerships launched without hand holding



Within 90 Days

--> Affiliate channel driving consistent and measurable revenue

Â --> Partners managed proactively with clear expectations and accountability

Â --> Reporting is reliable, data driven, and used to guide decisions

Â --> Founder is not chasing follow ups, payments, or missed deliverables



Requirements



You should not apply unless most of the following are true:

--> You have managed affiliate, influencer, or creator partnerships for ecommerce or DTC brands

Â --> You are highly organized and comfortable juggling multiple relationships and timelines

Â --> You are proactive and take ownership without waiting for instructions

Â --> You communicate clearly and directly with partners and internal teams

Â --> You are comfortable negotiating agreements and setting expectations

Â --> You can analyze performance data and translate it into actions

Â --> You have experience with tools like Asana, Shopify, Google Sheets, and affiliate or tracking platforms

Â --> You understand how creators, paid media, and ecommerce work together to drive sales

Â --> You can commit full time, working 40 hours per week



How to Apply



Send a message with:

--> Your resume

Â --> A brief overview of why you are a strong fit for this role

Â --> Any relevant experience managing affiliates, influencers, or creator campaigns

This position works directly with the President and has the ability to organize and complete efficiently and effectively a variety of recurring and new assignments.  Someone that is solution oriented to complete projects.



We are a highly productive team working full 8-hour days in a fast-paced environment. This role requires strong focus, ownership, and attention to detail, with the goal of fully managing transaction and administrative responsibilities so the team can perform at a high level.



Key Responsibilities

? Manage daily calendars, meetings, and
 correspondence

? Oversee scheduling and customer service for Airbnb, Furnished Finders, and rental properties

? Coordinate with vendors and manage business-related purchases

? Perform daily reconciliation for property redevelopment projects

? Manage transaction timelines, deadlines, and related tasks efficiently

? Communicate clearly and professionally with clients, agents, vendors, and stakeholders

? Prepare, review, and submit transaction documents accurately and on time

? Coordinate inspections, repairs, and closing-related appointments

? Maintain accurate and up-to-date client records in the CRM/database

? Ensure file compliance, accuracy, and quality control

? Conduct daily check-ins on active listings, contracts, and assigned projects



Qualifications

? Real estate transaction or administrative experience preferred

? Strong organizational, communication, and time-management skills

? Detail-oriented, proactive, and solution-focused

? Project management knowledge (a plus)

? Construction background and familiarity with AI tools (Claude, HeyGen, Gamini, Nano, ChatGPT) (a plus)

? Coachable, dependable, and interested in long-term growth

? High proficiency in U.S. English



About Us:

With over 30 years of real estate experience, The Swick Real Estate Group & Downsize Allies provides an all-inclusive downsizing and estate transition service. Our mission is to remove stress and simplify the process through personalized, insight-driven solutionsâ€”while working hard, working smart, and enjoying what we do.

$6.00â€“$10.00 per hour (USD)

Open to part-time or full-time, depending on fit.

Send a 2â€“3 minute video sharing your skills, why this role matters to you, and your interest in a long-term career to:

title: Financial Operations Specialist (Remote)
description:
Remote Financial Operations Specialist (Full-Time VA â€“ Philippines)

Own the Financial Engine at Property Rush



Be the Guardian of Our Numbers, Cash Flow, and Clarity

Are you an elite-level bookkeeper with CFO-level instincts? Do you thrive in building financial systems, forecasting cash flow, and producing clean, accurate books every single month? Are you the kind of person who finds errors before anyone else even sees the numbers?



If spreadsheets, reconciliations, and financial clarity are your love language â€” we want you.

Weâ€™re hiring a Full-Time Financial Operations Specialist (Remote) who will oversee the entire financial heartbeat of Property Rush. Youâ€™ll manage the books, own month-end close, produce financial statements, keep cash flow predictable, protect margins, and give leadership the clean data needed to make informed decisions.



This is a role for someone who is reliable, disciplined, detail-obsessed, and hungry for growth inside a fast-paced real estate company. This is not data-entry bookkeeping. This is high-ownership financial leadership!



__________________________________________________



???? Why Youâ€™ll Love This Role

Own the Financial Engine

Youâ€™ll run our entire financial workflow â€” from reconciliations to reporting to forecasting.



Be a Strategic Partner

Youâ€™ll work directly with the CEO and senior leadership team to ensure our numbers tell the truth and support growth.



Build the Systems That Scale Us

Youâ€™ll refine bookkeeping processes, automate workflows, and implement smarter financial controls.



Make a True Impact

When our numbers are tight, our business grows â€” and youâ€™ll be at the center of that growth.



__________________________________________________



???? What Youâ€™ll Do

20% â€“ BIG ROCKS (Critical Financial Responsibilities)

These are the highest-level, do-first, mission-critical responsibilities:

? Month-End Close (Complete Within 10 Days)

- Reconcile all accounts (cash, credit cards, loans, AR/AP, escrow, deposits).

- Generate accurate monthly financial statements (P&L, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow).

- Deliver clean, final books to leadership every month.



? Cash Flow Forecasting (12-Month Rolling)

- Maintain a real-time cash flow forecasting spreadsheet.

- Track all upcoming obligations and expected income.

- Keep forecast accuracy within 5% variance month over month.

- Plot all contractor invoices, recurring expenses, and property obligations before payment approval.



? Budgeting & Reporting

- Help build and maintain annual budget.

- Produce monthly variance reports (budget vs actual).

- Flag overspending, slow payers, or margin compression before it becomes a problem.



? Compliance & Tax Prep Support

- Maintain clean books for CPA review.

- Track 1099 vendors, reconcile receipts, and prepare files for tax season.

- Ensure real estateâ€“specific compliance (security deposits, escrow tracking, PM fees, rehab costs).



? Process Improvement

- Build scalable bookkeeping systems.

- Automate workflows inside QuickBooks / Xero / Google Sheets.

- Improve accuracy and reduce manual entries.



__________________________________________________



80% â€“ DAILY & WEEKLY FINANCIAL OPERATIONS

These are recurring tasks that keep our financial engine running:



?Accounts Payable

- Process vendor invoices.

- Verify job-cost accuracy for property rehabs.

- Ensure 100% on-time payments.



?Accounts Receivable

- Track incoming rents, investor payments, loan payments, and revenue.

- Follow up on late payments with professionalism.



?Payroll & Contractor Payments

- Prepare payroll reports for U.S. processor.

- Track hours, reimbursements, and recurring contractor fees.



?Property-Level Bookkeeping

- Track rehab budgets, cost overruns, and job costing by line item.

- Reconcile utility bills, rent rolls, deposits, escrows.



?Financial Organization

- Maintain organized digital filing for statements, invoices, and documents.

- Keep leadershipâ€™s financial dashboard updated weekly.



?Weekly/Monthly Reporting

- Weekly cash position update.

- Weekly AR/AP status.

- Weekly/Monthly KPI dashboard.



__________________________________________________



???? KPIs (Key Performance Indicators)

These metrics define success in this role:

???? Month-End Close Completed by Day 10

100% on-time delivery every month.



???? Financial Accuracy â€“ Zero Material Errors

Books must tie out to the penny â€” consistently.



???? Cash Flow Forecast Accuracy

Maintain ? 5% variance between forecasted vs. actual cash flow.



???? 100% On-Time Vendor Payments

No late payments without prior approval



???? Clean Books for CPA Review

No major findings or issues during annual tax prep or audits.



???? Cost Savings Identified & Executed

Help us lower expenses and improve margins every single quarter.



__________________________________________________



? Youâ€™re a Fit If Youâ€¦

- Are detail-obsessed and take pride in accuracy.

- Love creating order, clarity, and clean numbers.

- Work fast, independently, and donâ€™t need daily supervision.

- Think like a controller, not a clerk â€” you see the big picture.

- Can manage multiple entities (LLCs, flips, rentals, PM).

- Understand real estate bookkeeping (ideal, but not required if you learn fast).

- Are hungry, humble, proactive, and solution-oriented.

- Want long-term, stable, full-time work.



__________________________________________________



???? Skills & Requirements

- 3+ years bookkeeping/accounting experience (real estate preferred).

- Strong QuickBooks Online or Xero experience.

- Strong Excel/Google Sheets skills (pivot tables, formulas, formatting).

- Experience with AP/AR, reconciliations, and financial reporting.

- Fluent English (written and verbal).

- Reliable computer + internet.

- Ability to work U.S. hours (EST preferred).

- Experience with multi-entity bookkeeping is a major plus.



__________________________________________________



???? Perks & Benefits

- Full-time, long-term remote role.

- Work directly with the CEO.

- Growth path toward Finance Manager / Controller.

- Paid time off + paid PH holidays.

- Access to training & development resources.

- Stable, meaningful role inside a mission-driven U.S. real estate company.



__________________________________________________



???? Why Join Property Rush?

Weâ€™re a fast-growing real estate investment and property management company focused on stewardship, integrity, and growth (S.I.G.). Our mission is to provide affordable, quality housing while building a thriving business and strong investment community.

If you want to join a team that values accuracy, excellence, and continuous improvement â€” youâ€™ll feel at home here.



__________________________________________________



???? Ready to Lead Our Financial Systems?

If youâ€™re a meticulous bookkeeper who can think strategically and deliver clean books every month, weâ€™d love to meet you.

???? Apply now and help us scale with confidence.



__________________________________________________



As part of our pre-screening process, we kindly ask you to complete both the Culture Index and Personality Assessment provided below. Completing these assessments is required for us to move your application to the next stage. Only applicants who completed the assessments will be processed.



1. Culture Index Assessment

title: Replo Landing Page & Conversion Specialist (Part-Time)
description:
Job Title: Replo Landing Page & Conversion Specialist (Part-Time)

Salary: $1,000 AUD / month

Type: Part-Time (AI-Native)

Website: 

The Mission

Your goal is to increase our store's conversion rate and AOV through high-velocity landing page testing. You will use Replo to build beautiful, fast-loading, and high-converting funnels. You aren't just a designer; you are a direct-response architect who understands the psychology of why women buy beauty products.

Your Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)

Conversion Rate (CR): Improve the landing page CR for our "3-Pack Box" offer.

Average Order Value (AOV): Implement backend Shopify integrations and upsell modules to increase the dollar value of every click.

Build Velocity: Ability to turn a creative concept into a live Replo page in under 24 hours.

Mobile Optimization: Ensure 100% of pages are "Mobile-First" with sub-2-second load times.

Core Responsibilities

Funnel Architecture: Build high-converting Listicles (e.g., "5 Reasons Women are Swapping Night Creams for Mouth Tape"), Advertorials, and Long-form Sales Pages.

Replo Mastery: Fully manage the Replo environment, including global components, mobile styling, and dynamic Shopify integrations.

Backend Integration: Connect pages seamlessly to the Shopify checkout, ensuring all tracking (Pixels/GTM) and "Gifts with Purchase" are functioning perfectly.

AI-Speed: Use AI tools (like ChatGPT or Midjourney) to generate high-converting copy and custom imagery at 10x speed.

Swipe File Execution: Leverage your existing library of 7-8 figure e-commerce funnels to model winning structures for Beauty Sleep Club.

Who You Are

Direct Response Native: You understand the "Problem-Agitation-Solution" framework.

Replo Power-User: You know the platform inside and out and don't need a developer to help you.

Fast & Iterative: You thrive on feedback from the Media Buyer and move quickly to test new "Hooks" on the page.

title: Wordpress SEO & Content Strategist
description:
About Scaliency:



Scaliency is a Phoenix, Arizona-based growth marketing agency that builds complete growth systems for service-based businesses -- websites, paid ads (Google & Meta), SEO, content, CRM automation, and AI-powered lead management. Our clients include home service companies, auto repair shops, contractors, and other service businesses across the US. We are quickly growing and are building our core team to support that growth.





Job Description:



You will be Scaliency's dedicated SEO Specialist -- the person responsible for making our clients findable online. You'll handle the full SEO cycle for each client: keyword research, content creation and publishing, on-page optimization, link building, citation management, and Google Business Profile management. Your work compounds over time and becomes the organic engine that drives long-term client growth alongside our paid advertising efforts.





Responsibilities:



- Conduct keyword research, competitor analysis, and build monthly content plans for each client using our premium SEO platform (Search Atlas -- training available).



- Create SEO-optimized content using Search Atlas and our AI tools (Gemini, Claude, ChatGPT), then edit every piece for human quality, accuracy, and brand voice.



- Publish content directly in WordPress using pre-built page templates.



- Apply on-page SEO in WordPress via RankMath -- meta tags, heading structure, internal linking, schema, alt text, clean URLs.



- Execute white-hat link building -- backlink outreach, editorial submissions, and guest post outreach using Search Atlas tools.



- Build and manage business citations across key directories (Google, Yelp, BBB, Bing Places, Apple Maps, and industry-specific).



- Optimize and manage Google Business Profiles -- descriptions, categories, photos, weekly posts, Q&A, review response drafts.



- Run monthly technical SEO audits and monitor Google Search Console for all client sites.



- Track keyword rankings weekly, monitor organic traffic, and report on SEO performance monthly.



- Coordinate with our Web Developer for site-level SEO needs and custom page builds.





Requirements: 



- 3+ years SEO experience (Technical, On-Page & Off-Page SEO).



- Experience with professional SEO platforms (Ahrefs, SEMrush, Moz, or similar).



- Keyword research and content strategy.



- On-page SEO implementation in WordPress (RankMath or Yoast, heading structure, meta optimization, internal linking).



- Off-page SEO execution -- link building, outreach, and citation building with real results.



- Google Business Profile optimization and management experience.



- Google Search Console proficiency.



- Content editing skills -- can read AI-generated content, spot quality issues, and edit for natural readability.



- WordPress Expertise.



- Excellent written & spoken English.





Nice to have: Local SEO specialization, schema markup (JSON-LD) knowledge, HARO/digital PR experience, experience with service-based businesses, US local market understanding, technical SEO audit experience.





Tools You'll Use (All Provided):



- Search Atlas



- RankMathSEO Pro



- Google Search Console, Google Analytics 4, Google Business Profile



-Scaliency AI Content Tools Premium Subscriptions (Claude, Gemini, ChatGPT)



-WordPress



-Swydo (SEO Reporting)





What Working With Us Looks Like:



- Fully remote -- work from anywhere.



- Full-time, Monday-Friday, 40 hours/week.



- Minimum 4 hours overlap with 9am-5pm MST (Arizona time).



- Communication via Slack, Clickup and/or 
 / Whatsapp.



- Weekly video check-ins + ad-hoc video / audio calls as needed.



- Long-term position -- we invest in training and want you to grow with us.

title: Level 2 - IT Support Technician
description:
Working Schedule: Monday - Friday, Eastern Standard Time



Note: Although this position is classified as a Level 2 Technician, you will initially perform Level 1 tasks. This is to ensure you are fully acclimated to our tools, systems, and processes before transitioning to full Level 2 responsibilities.



About the Role

Weâ€™re looking for a remote Level 2 IT Support Technician who loves technology, takes initiative, and communicates clearly. Youâ€™ll provide day-to-day desktop and Microsoft 365 support to end users across multiple clients, working closely with engineers and the Service Desk Coordinator. This role requires someone with strong Level 2 experience, especially in creating structured SOPs and adapting quickly to new technologies.



Key Responsibilities

â€¢ Provide remote desktop, laptop, and mobile support via our ticketing and remote-access tools.

â€¢ Troubleshoot hardware, software, and network issues (Windows 10/11, macOS, VPN, DNS/DHCP).

â€¢ Escalate complex issues to Tier 2/Tier 3 as needed while ensuring timely client updates.

â€¢ Maintain proactive monitoring, patching, and backup checks.

â€¢ Learn and adopt new technologies and tools as part of continuous improvement.

â€¢ Collaborate virtually with the NYC Service Desk team during Eastern Time business hours.



Required Experience & Skills

â€¢ 3+ years of IT support experience in a professional or corporate environment (financial sector a plus).

â€¢ Prior MSP experience is required â€” must have supported multi-client environments.

â€¢ Proven Level 2 technical experience, including troubleshooting advanced issues and creating operational SOPs.

â€¢ 2+ years of Microsoft 365 / Azure AD administration (MS-900 or equivalent preferred).

â€¢ Strong understanding of Windows OS, networking fundamentals, and security best practices.

â€¢ Ability to quickly learn new technologies, platforms, and tools.

â€¢ Excellent written and verbal communication skills â€” able to explain technical concepts to non-technical users.

â€¢ Highly organized, proactive, and comfortable working independently.

title: AI Video Pipeline Developer (ComfyUI, Python, RunPod) â€” Full-Time or Project-Based
description:
We're a U.S.-based AI video production company looking for a skilled developer to build an automated video production pipeline. This is a real project with clear scope and a path to long-term ongoing work.

The Project:

We produce AI-generated marketing videos for real estate agents. Currently this involves manual editing and multiple AI platform subscriptions. We want to automate the pipeline so that a script + reference photos go in, and a near-finished video comes out â€” with human review at key checkpoints.

Three phases:



Script-to-storyboard engine with API-based image and video generation (~$2,000 / ?115,000)

Self-hosted generation on RunPod + ComfyUI â€” batch processing, avatar training, lip sync (~$5,000-$7,000 / ?285,000-?400,000)

Automated video assembly, templates, Premiere Pro integration (~$5,000-$8,000 / ?285,000-?460,000)



We have: Structured training data (342 video cuts in JSON), a partially built Next.js app, existing API integrations, clear technical specifications for each phase.

Skills Required:



Strong Python (async programming, API integration, queue systems)

ComfyUI experience (building workflows, using the API, custom nodes)

RunPod or GPU cloud deployment (Docker, persistent storage, model management)

FLUX / Stable Diffusion (ControlNet, IP-Adapter, LoRA training, AnimateDiff)

FFmpeg or MoviePy for programmatic video editing

Next.js / TypeScript (for extending the UI)



Big Plus:



Lip sync models (MuseTalk, SadTalker, Wav2Lip)

AI coding tools in your workflow (Claude Code, Cursor, Copilot)

Understanding of video production (editing concepts, timelines, transitions)



What we're looking for in a person:



Self-directed problem solver â€” we give you the spec, you figure out the implementation

Strong communicator â€” async updates, clear documentation, honest about blockers

Uses AI to work faster â€” we're an AI company, we expect our developer to leverage AI tools

Portfolio required â€” show us ComfyUI workflows, ML pipelines, or automation projects you've built



Compensation:



Phase 1: ?115,000 ($2,000 USD) fixed project

Full scope: ?690,000-?975,000 ($12,000-$17,000 USD) across all phases

If transitioning to ongoing: ?60,000-?120,000/month ($1,000-$2,000/month) depending on hours and skill level

Open to full-time or project-based â€” discuss in interview

title: Content Strategist / Marketing Specialist
description:
Department: Marketing

Hours: 5â€“10 hours per week



Company Overview: Fireproof CPR & Medical Testing is a CPR training organization dedicated to equipping everyday heroes with the confidence and skills to act in emergencies. We donâ€™t just certify instructors. We help them think like business owners.



Our mission is to equip individuals, organizations, and communities with lifesaving skills that prepare people to act confidently in emergenciesâ€”through exceptional CPR and First Aid training and education. As we expand nationally, we are building systems, programs, and leadership pathways that support instructors beyond certificationâ€”into entrepreneurship, ownership, and community impact.



Role Summary: We are seeking a highly skilled Content Strategist / Marketing Specialist to support business growth by creating content, executing lead generation, organic marketing, outreach, and
 campaigns. This role focuses on consistency, follow-up, and relationship-based marketing to increase class registrations, event attendance, and inbound inquiries.



The Content Strategist / Marketing Specialist is responsible for owning the businessâ€™s content ecosystemâ€”ensuring that what we publish is intentional, consistent, aligned with revenue goals, and reflective of the founderâ€™s voice. This role exists to remove the founder as the daily content bottleneck while still preserving authenticity, authority, and strategic clarity.



Core Responsibilities:



1. Content Strategy & Positioning - Translate business goals (classes, programs, launches) into content direction and align messaging across platforms (social,
, LinkedIn)



2. Content Planning & Execution - Build and maintain a rolling content calendar, create content briefs and outlines for execution, ensure deadlines are met and content actually goes live, and ensure content is repurposed efficiently across channels



3. Event & Class Marketing - Promote upcoming CPR classes and events and support partnerships or community outreach initiatives



4.
 Marketing - Design
 marketing campaigns, schedule
 broadcasts, and assist with basic
 sequences (welcome, reminders, promotions). Maintain
 list segments and track and report open and click rates



5. Lead Generation & Outreach - Research and build targeted lead lists, conduct LinkedIn outreach and follow-ups, and track leads and responses in the designated system





Required Skills & Experience



Must-Haves

* Proven experience in content strategy (not just posting)

* Strong written communication and ability to translate abstract ideas into clear messaging

*
 marketing design, flow and automations

* Strategic thinking paired with execution follow-through

* Organized and detail-oriented



Nice-to-Haves

* Event promotion experience

* Experience with service-based or online education businesses

* Community or thought-leadership content experience



Ideal Candidate Profile



This role is ideal for someone who:

* Thinks in systems, not one-off posts

* Enjoys shaping ideas more than chasing trends

* Is comfortable owning direction

* Can balance creativity, strategy and practicality

* Understands that consistency beats creativity without structure



Success Metrics (High-Level)

1. Content is published consistently without founder micromanagement

2. Messaging feels aligned, intentional, and cohesive

3. Founder spends less time thinking about content

4. Content supports lead generation, classes, and offers

Hourly Rate: $6-8 per hour

title: Head of Digital Revenue, Marketplaces and DTC
description:
About Us



We are a Canadian manufacturer established in 1990. Our brands, Plastair, DeeVa, and PlastairFyre, are built on differentiated products, strong margins, and when appropriate, utility patents or design patents. We manufacture in Canada, or source electronics overseas, then protect and position them properly.



We have dominated brick and mortar retail for decades. Now we are building a serious digital revenue engine. Our online presence is underdeveloped relative to our product strength, and we want fast, measurable improvement without the owner being the day to day operator.



The Role



This is a full time leadership role for a true owner operator. You will own digital revenue results across Amazon Seller, Shopify DTC, and additional marketplaces including Walmart, Wayfair, and digital B2B platforms such as Faire and Grainger.



This is not a VA role, not a coordinator role, not a task manager role. Your job is to build the machine, lead people, make decisions, and remove work from ownershipâ€™s plate.



You will manage and leverage our existing Amazon operations resource, Arnel, and you will rebuild our creative production function to improve speed, accuracy, and quality.



What Success Looks Like



Within 60 to 90 days, ownership should experience a real reduction in day to day decisions, fewer errors, faster execution, clearer reporting, and visible 
ntum across listings, creative, ads, and channel expansion.



If you do not remove work from the ownerâ€™s plate, you are not a fit.



Core Responsibilities

Digital revenue ownership and execution cadence



Own the digital revenue plan, priorities, and weekly execution cadence across all digital channels



Make decisions, do not push decisions upward unless budget risk or strategy change is required



Implement a simple weekly reporting system showing revenue, margin, conversion, TACOS, ACOS, ROAS, inventory health, and next actions



Marketplaces and Shopify DTC



Own Amazon Seller growth, SKU focus, pricing strategy, merchandising, promotions, and catalog health



Own Shopify DTC fundamentals, conversion rate improvement, product page quality, offers, and traffic plans



Launch and scale Walmart and Wayfair with correct catalog setup, content requirements, compliance, and fulfillment workflows



Plan and execute international Amazon expansion when unit economics and operational readiness support it



Digital B2B marketplaces



Own digital B2B marketplace performance including platforms such as Faire and Grainger



Ensure pricing, content, and inventory strategy align with brand positioning and avoid channel conflict



Coordinate onboarding, catalog setup, and ongoing optimization for digital wholesale platforms



Paid media strategy and performance



Own paid media strategy and budget allocation across Amazon ads and Meta, plus other channels as appropriate



You may execute ads yourself or manage a specialist, but you are accountable for outcomes



Build repeatable testing systems for keywords, creative, offers, and landing pages, not random changes



Creative, content, and influencer systems



Rebuild our creative production to improve speed, accuracy, and taste



Create a repeatable workflow for product images, video, A plus content, storefronts, and ad creative



Build an influencer and UGC pipeline that produces usable assets and measurable performance, not vanity metrics



Team leadership and accountability



Manage Arnel as Amazon Operations Lead, inventory, listings execution, and operational hygiene



Hire and manage the minimum team needed to win, typically 2 to 4 people across ads execution and creative production



Build SOPs so performance does not depend on any one person



What We Already Have



Strong product differentiation, IP strategy, and manufacturing capability



Existing Amazon operations support, currently part time



Clear need to rebuild creative production due to speed and error issues



Required Experience and Traits



Proven ownership of ecommerce growth and results, not just tasks



Experience managing Amazon Seller Central and at least two of the following, Shopify DTC, Walmart, Wayfair, Faire, Grainger



Demonstrated leadership, hiring, training, accountability, and building repeatable systems



Strong analytical thinking, comfortable with margin math and channel tradeoffs



High urgency, fast execution, high quality, low error tolerance



Fluent English, able to overlap 2 to 3 hours daily with Eastern Time



Full time commitment to one company and long term mindset



Performance Targets



Targets will be confirmed after your initial audit, but you should expect accountability for:



Meaningful growth from the current Amazon baseline while protecting contribution margin



Clean scalable paid media performance with controlled ACOS and improving TACOS over time



Walmart and Wayfair live with correct catalog, operational workflows, and launch plan



Clear improvement in listing quality, creative quality, and production speed



Digital B2B marketplace launches and optimization without channel conflict



International expansion roadmap for at least one additional Amazon region when economics support it



How to Apply, Required



Submit all items or you will be rejected.



Your resume



A 200 word plan for your first 90 days, specific to Plastair, DeeVa, and PlastairFyre, generic plans will be rejected



Links to brands, stores, or campaigns you directly managed, include specific results such as revenue impact, ACOS, TACOS, ROAS, conversion, growth rate

Optional, a 2 to 3 minute Loom video introducing yourself and explaining one case study win



Screening Note



We prioritize candidates who demonstrate ownership, decision making, and evidence of removing work from founders, not candidates who list tools and tasks.

description:

This role involves responding to inquiries, troubleshooting technical issues, and delivering clear, helpful, and accurate solutions.



The ideal candidate is personable, adaptable, and resourceful, with strong research and problem-solving skills. You should be comfortable understanding user needs and tailoring support based on context rather than relying on scripted responses.

title: E-commerce Finance Officer & Cashflow Strategist
description:
Salary: $1,500 / month (Full-Time)

Location: Remote (Philippines)

Tools: Xero, Shopify, Google Sheets/Excel, Triple Whale (optional)

The Mission

Your goal is to provide the CEO with total financial clarity. You will manage the daily, monthly, and yearly financial health of 
. You aren't just a bookkeeper; you are a cashflow architect who ensures we have the liquidity to scale inventory and ad spend aggressively.

Your Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)

Reporting Accuracy: 100% reconciliation of daily P&L statements.

Cash Efficiency: Maintain an optimized Cash Conversion Cycle (CCC) to prevent stockouts or liquidity crunches.

Compliance: On-time completion of monthly BAS statements and tax consolidations.

Cost Optimization: Identifying $2k - $5k in monthly "waste" (redundant software, shipping discrepancies, etc.).

Core Responsibilities

Daily P&L Tracking: Update the "CEO Metrics" sheet daily with COGS, Shipping, Ad Spend, and Net Profit.

Cashflow Forecasting: Provide a rolling 13-week cashflow forecast to predict inventory purchasing needs.

Xero Management: Handle all bank reconciliations, monthly P&Ls, and Balance Sheets.

Tax & Compliance: Complete monthly BAS statements and prepare all documents for year-end tax consolidation.

Inventory Liaison: Work with the Ops Manager to track "Value on Hand" and ensure deposit payments to suppliers are timed perfectly.

5 More Important Tasks for the Finance Officer

3PL & Shipping Audit: Weekly audit of ROBO3PL invoices to ensure we are actually being charged the $6.50 USD rate and spotting overcharges.

Ad Spend/Revenue Reconciliation: Cross-referencing Shopify "Net Sales" against Meta/Google "Attributed Sales" to find the "Truth" in data.

Payment Processor Optimization: Monitoring PayPal/Stripe/Shopify Pay holdbacks and fees to minimize "lost" percentage points on every transaction.

Unit Economics Stress-Testing: Running "What-If" scenarios (e.g., "If shipping increases 10%, how does that affect our $49 USD offer margin?").

Fixed Cost Management: Tracking the "Burn Rate" of our PH-based team and software stack to maintain a lean operation.

title: UGC Web Developer
description:
UGC Creator Portal â€“ Airtable + Softr Build for Growth Agency

About Us

We run a UGC growth agency working with consumer tech brands. We manage multiple creators producing content daily for different clients. We're currently managing workflows manually and need a streamlined creator portal to scale our operations efficiently.

What We Need Built

The Problem We're Solving

Right now, our content submission, approval, and performance tracking processes are scattered across 
,
, and spreadsheets. We need a centralized system where:



Creators can see available jobs and submit content in one organized place

Our team can approve/deny submissions with clear feedback loops

Content automatically organizes into client-specific folders

We can track creator performance without manual data entry



What You'll Build

Creator-Facing Portal (Softr):



Secure login system (each creator has their own account)

Job board showing available campaigns with details (client, requirements, pay, deadline)

Content upload interface where creators submit videos with metadata (campaign name, concept, TikTok/IG links)

Submission history view (pending, approved, denied status)

Basic earnings/stats dashboard



Admin Portal (Softr):



Separate admin login for our team

Job posting interface (create new campaigns, assign to creators)

Content review queue (approve/deny with feedback notes)

Dashboard showing: pending submissions, approval rates, turnaround times by creator

Client overview (see all content by client)



Backend Database (Airtable):



Creators table (contact info, social handles, performance metrics, payment details)

Jobs/Campaigns table (client name, requirements, budget, deadline, status)

Content Submissions table (linked to creators and jobs, approval status, video URLs, view counts)

Clients table (contact info, active campaigns, content library)

Properly linked relational database structure



Automations (Zapier or 
):



When content is approved ? save video link to Google Drive in correct client folder

When content is uploaded ? notify assigned account manager

When content is denied ? notify creator with feedback

Weekly digest
 summarizing pending approvals



Must-Have Features



Mobile-responsive (creators will access from phones)

Clean, professional UI (represents our brand to creators)

Role-based permissions (creators see only their stuff, admins see everything)

File organization system that mirrors our Google Drive structure

Notification system (
 alerts for key actions)



Nice-to-Have Features



Bulk upload capability for multiple videos at once

Filtering/search functionality (by client, by creator, by date, by status)

Basic analytics dashboard (submission volume over time, top performers)

Integration with payment tracking (so we can log what we've paid creators)



What We're Looking For

Required Experience:



Proven experience building Airtable databases with relational structures

Experience building client portals or login systems using Softr

Comfortable with Zapier or 
 for workflow automation

Strong understanding of user experience (this needs to be intuitive for non-technical users)

Portfolio showing similar projects you've completed



Bonus Points:



Experience working with content creators or agencies

Understanding of Google Drive API integration

Experience with performance tracking dashboards

Knowledge of TikTok/Instagram API for pulling view counts (optional future phase)



Deliverables



Fully configured Airtable base with all tables, fields, views, and relationships

Softr portal (creator-facing + admin-facing) connected to Airtable

Zapier/Make automations set up and tested

Documentation explaining how to use the system (for our team)

Simple video walkthrough showing how to add jobs, review content, onboard new creators

30 days of post-launch support for bugs or adjustments



Timeline



Initial setup call to review requirements: Week 1

Build and testing: Weeks 2-3

Training and handoff: Week 4



We're ready to start immediately with the right person.

To Apply

Please include:



Links to 2-3 similar projects you've built (Airtable + Softr portals, login systems, or creator/client management tools)

Brief description of your approach to building this (tools you'd use, how you'd structure the database)

Estimated timeline for delivery

Your availability (hours per week you can commit)

Any clarifying questions you have about the scope



Note: We're looking for someone who can think through workflows and suggest improvements, not just follow instructions. If you see a better way to structure something, we want to hear it.

title: Real Estate Listing Coordinator
description:
We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Listing Coordinator to support our growing real estate team. The Listing Coordinator plays a critical role in managing the listing process from signed agreement through closing, ensuring a smooth, professional experience for both sellers and agents.



This position is ideal for someone who thrives in fast-paced environments, enjoys managing timelines, and has at least 1 year of real estate transaction or listing coordination experience.

Manage all listing files from signed listing agreement through closing

Enter and maintain listing data in MLS, CRM, and transaction management systems

Coordinate professional photography, staging, lockbox installation, and sign placement

Ensure all compliance documents are completed and properly submitted

Prepare and schedule â€œComing Soonâ€ and active listing marketing timelines

Communicate regularly with agents, sellers, photographers, title companies, and vendors

Track deadlines and ensure all listing tasks are completed on time

Application Requirements

, and phone number)

title: WordPress Web Developer & Designer
description:
About Scaliency:



Scaliency is a Phoenix, Arizona-based growth marketing agency that builds complete growth systems for service-based businesses -- websites, paid ads (Google & Meta), SEO, content, CRM automation, and AI-powered lead management. Our clients include home service companies, auto repair shops, contractors, coaches, retail shops, and other service businesses across the US. We're growing quickly and are building our core team to support that growth.





Job Description:



You will be Scaliency's primary website builder and designer. You'll redesign outdated client websites into modern, conversion-focused sites (about 60% of projects), build brand-new WordPress websites from scratch (about 40%), create landing pages for ad campaigns, and maintain all client websites. Everything you build is what clients and prospects see first -- so it needs to be polished, mobile-responsive, and built to convert visitors into leads.





Responsibilities:



- Build and redesign WordPress websites using Elementor Pro -- from template selection to final QA and launch.



- Generate page content using our AI tools (Claude, Gemini, ChatGPT), then edit everything for natural readability and brand voice.



- Implement conversion elements across all sites -- forms, pop-ups, CTAs, click-to-call, chat widgets, booking calendars.



- Build dedicated landing pages for PPC campaigns.



- Create reusable Elementor page templates for our SEO Specialist to publish ongoing content.



- Configure on-page SEO technicals on builds (RankMath, heading hierarchy, alt text, clean URLs).



- Maintain all client WordPress sites -- plugin updates, speed optimization, security, content updates.



- Embed external forms and widgets (GoHighLevel, Gravity Forms, other CRM forms, review widgets, calendars).



- Coordinate with our SEO Specialist and Tracking Specialist to ensure sites support the full marketing system.





Requirements:



- 3+ years WordPress development with Elementor / Elementor Pro.



- Strong visual design sense -- your sites look custom and polished.



- Experience redesigning existing websites (template swaps, rebrands, page restructuring).



- Experience building WordPress websites from scratch.



- High-conversion page design understanding (CTA placement, mobile-first layout, user flow).



- Mobile-responsive design across all devices.



- Excellent written & spoken English



- Page speed optimization (image compression, lazy loading, efficient Elementor usage).



- On-page SEO Experience (RankMath or Yoast, heading structure, meta tags, alt text).





Nice to have: WooCommerce experience, CSS/HTML for custom tweaks, Envato Elements familiarity, SiteGround hosting knowledge, CRO understanding.





Tools You'll Use (All Provided):



- Elementor Pro



- Envato Elements



- Gravity Forms, RankMath SEO Pro, Imagify



- SiteGround Hosting



- Scaliency AI Content Tools Premium Subscriptions (Claude, Gemini, ChatGPT)



- WooCommerce





What Working With Us Looks Like:

 and phone inquiries professionally and efficiently.

title: Healthcare Recruiter
description:
Job description:



We are a growing U.S.-based healthcare company seeking a Recruiter / Interview Specialist to support therapist hiring across multiple departments.



This role is call-heavy and interview-focused, with additional responsibility for coordinating hiring needs and tracking recruitment progress. Approximately 90% of your work will involve phone interviews with therapist candidates.



If you are not comfortable being on calls for most of your shift, this role is not a good fit.



Role Overview



â€¢ You will conduct daily phone interviews with licensed therapists (PT, OT, ST, PTA, COTA), coordinate with internal teams on hiring needs, and manage the recruitment pipeline from job posting through candidate handoff.

 â€¢ You are the first point of contact for candidates and a key link between departments, so professionalism, organization, and communication are essential.



Key Responsibilities



â€¢ Interviewing & Screening (Primary Focus)

â€¢ Conduct high-volume phone interviews daily with therapist candidates.

â€¢ Screen candidates for: Licensure and credentials, Experience and specialties, Availability and geographic coverage, 



Communication skills and professionalism

â€¢ Clearly explain roles, expectations, and next steps.

â€¢ Identify red flags and escalate concerns when necessary.

â€¢ Recruitment Coordination & Follow-Ups

â€¢ Follow up with candidates after interviews as needed.

â€¢ Coordinate with internal departments (staffing, operations, leadership) to understand current and upcoming hiring needs.

â€¢ Schedule next steps and hand off qualified candidates appropriately.

â€¢ Maintain timely and professional communication with candidates throughout the process.

â€¢ Job Posting & Process Tracking

â€¢ Post job openings on approved platforms as hiring needs change.

â€¢ Track candidates through each stage of the recruitment process.

â€¢ Keep recruitment trackers or ATS accurate and up to date.

â€¢ Provide basic updates on hiring progress when requested.



What Weâ€™re Looking For



â€¢ Comfortable being on the phone most of the workday.

â€¢ Clear, confident, professional speaking voice.

â€¢ Strong listening and judgment skills.

â€¢ Highly organized and detail-oriented.

â€¢ Able to manage follow-ups and coordination without losing 
ntum.



Qualifications



â€¢ 1â€“2+ years of experience in: Recruiting, Healthcare staffing, HR screening, Call center interviewing

â€¢ Excellent spoken and written English.

â€¢ Comfortable conducting multiple interviews per day.

â€¢ Familiar with Google Workspace (Sheets, Docs).

â€¢ Bonus: Experience recruiting healthcare professionals or independent contractors.



Requirements



â€¢ Reliable internet connection.

â€¢ Quiet, professional work environment for calls.

â€¢ Ability to work U.S. (PST) business hours.

â€¢ Part-time or full-time availability (to be discussed).



Job Type: Part-time



Benefits:



â€¢ Paid training

â€¢ Work from home



Experience:



â€¢ Recruiting: 2 years (Required)

â€¢ Work Location: Remote

title: Virtual Assistant â€“ Short-Term Rental Operations
description:
Guest Communication & Support

Respond promptly to all guest inquiries across booking platforms (Airbnb, Vrbo, 
, direct bookings,Hospitable).

Provide accurate check-in/check-out instructions and resolve common guest questions.

Monitor guest reviews and flag feedback for improvement.

Escalate complex or unresolved issues to the Operations Manager when necessary.



Guest Issues & Troubleshooting

Serve as the first line of support for guest-reported problems (Wi-Fi, TV, appliances, access issues, etc.).

Proactively research solutions using Google, YouTube, ChatGPT, or vendor manuals before escalating.

Call guests directly (when needed) to walk them through troubleshooting steps.

Document all attempted solutions and outcomes in the task log.

Escalate only if:

The issue cannot be solved remotely after troubleshooting, OR

It poses a safety/security risk (e.g., water leak, broken lock, electrical hazard).



Reservation & Calendar Management

Confirm all bookings, cancellations, and modifications are properly updated in PMS/channel manager.

Ensure calendars remain accurate across all platforms.

Track and communicate special requests (early check-in, late check-out, amenities).



Cleaner Communication & Oversight

Send daily turnover schedules and instructions to cleaners at least 24 hours in advance.

Confirm cleaner acknowledgment for every scheduled job.

Review photos/videos after turnovers:

Confirm staging, linens, and supplies reset according to SOPs.

Flag any damages or missing items immediately to the Ops Manager.

Ensure same-day reporting of damages or cleanliness issues.

Maintain an up-to-date roster of cleaners and escalate no-shows/failures immediately.



Vendor & Maintenance Communication

Log all maintenance issues reported by guests or cleaners.

For minor issues, call vendors directly to explain the problem and check availability.

Collect multiple quotes or timing options (when time allows) and report to the Ops Manager.

Coordinate appointments, confirm access codes or guest permissions, and ensure vendor arrival.

Request before/after photos and completion notes from vendors.

At least one additional monitor for multitasking.

Maintain system security and confidentiality (no shared accounts; VPN when required).

Let me know what you favorite food is in the first line of your response.
