title: HubSpot Data & Reporting Specialist
description:
Ironslate Inc. is a production intelligence and vendor strategy firm built for high-volume studios. We help streamline physical production by saving time, cutting costs, and providing real-time data that supports smarter decision-making for film and television projects. Our team works closely with studio executives and line producers to bring clarity and insight to complex production workflows.



We are looking for a detail-obsessed HubSpot expert who loves clean data, clear reports, and organized systems. This is a full-time, long-term role for someone who is confident in HubSpot, comfortable with data, and excited to support a growing team in the film/entertainment space.



-

[ Role Overview ]



Title: HubSpot Specialist (with Virtual Assistant responsibilities)



Schedule: Full-time role, with at least 3 hours of overlap between 2 PMâ€“5 PM Pacific Time (PST/PDT). The rest of your schedule is flexible as long as itâ€™s consistent, Mondayâ€“Friday.



Compensation: Depending on experience



Works Closely With: EA/Sales Admin



In this role, about 80% of your time will be spent inside HubSpot and related tools, managing data, reports, and enrichment. The remaining 20% will be general virtual assistant and operations support with a need for quick turnaround on those types of tasks.



-

[ A Day in the Life ]



On a typical day, you will:



1. Start your shift by checking Slack and
 for new tasks, updates, and priorities.



2. Review and update tasks in Asana so nothing falls through the cracks.



3. Log into HubSpot to:

a. Generate, update, and share reports and dashboards for sales and studio intelligence.

b. Enrich contact and company records with accurate details.

c. Clean up and standardize studios, companies, and contact roles.



4. Import and export data between our software Iron Intel (our proprietary lead-scraping / production intel tool) and HubSpot as needed.



5. Support the team with ad hoc admin/VA tasks that need fast, reliable follow-through.



This is a role for someone who enjoys structured work, takes pride in accurate data, and likes being the â€œsource of truthâ€ for information.



-

[ Key Responsibilities ]

 

> 1. HubSpot Data, Reporting, and Enrichment (? 80%)

a. Keep our HubSpot CRM clean, accurate, and up to date.



b. Create, maintain, and improve HubSpot reports and dashboards for:

- Sales pipeline visibility

- Studio and vendor tracking

- Meeting and outreach activity



c. Perform regular contact and company enrichment, including:

- Adding LinkedIn profile URLs

- Ensuring first name, last name,
, phone number, and role are correctly filled wherever possible

- Tagging and categorizing studios/companies in a consistent way (e.g. film vs series)



d. Clean up Studios & Contacts in HubSpot:

- Reduce duplicate or confusing company entries

- Align studios under simplified company names

- Make sure each contact has a clear role and relationship to the studio/company



e. Work with Ways of Working (WoW) documents (our SOPs) to follow and improve our data processes over time.



> 2. Iron Intel & Lead Management

a. Import leads from Iron Intel into HubSpot and ensure fields are mapped correctly.



b. Export data from HubSpot/Iron Intel for reporting and sharing with clients when needed.



c. Add locations and other key metadata into Iron Intel and keep it structured.



> 3. Research & Pre-Meeting Briefs

a. When there is an upcoming meeting, research the studio and key contacts.



b. Prepare a concise 1-page brief with:

- Recent projects and credits

- Notable accolades or awards

- Recent news or press (fresh information, not outdated)



c. Deliver this brief in time to prepare our Sales team ahead of important meetings.



> 4. Virtual Assistant & Operations Support (? 20%)

a. Support our EA/Sales Admin  and the team with quick-turn administrative tasks such as:

- Creating and sending documents from templates.

- Updating tasks in Asana and ensuring follow-through.

- Light coordination support via Google Calendar and
.



b. Help keep our internal systems organized (Drive folders, simple tracking sheets, notes, etc.).



c. Use tools like Slack, Google Workspace, Asana, Canva, HubSpot, and Iron Intel as part of your daily workflow.



-

[ Tools Youâ€™ll Use ]

You donâ€™t need to be an expert in everything on day one, but you should be very strong in HubSpot and comfortable learning other tools.



- HubSpot CRM (reports, lists, workflows, data imports/exports)

- Iron Intel (our internal lead/production intel software â€“ we will train you)

- Slack (day-to-day team communication)

- Google Workspace (Gmail, Calendar, Drive, Docs, Sheets, Slides)

- Asana (task and project tracking)

- Canva (simple visual assets or basic layouts as needed)

- Other tools from time to time as our stack evolves



-

[ The Kind of Person Who Will Thrive Here ]



Weâ€™re looking for someone who:

- Is highly detail-oriented and takes pride in clean, accurate data.

- Enjoys structured work, checklists, and clearly defined processes (and also notices when a process can be improved).

- Is proactive and self-directed: you ask clarifying questions, follow through on tasks, and anticipate needs rather than waiting to be told every step.

- Communicates clearly in written English (for notes, briefs, task descriptions, and async updates).

- Is comfortable working in a remote, startup-style environment where priorities can shift.

- Is respectful, collaborative, and comfortable working closely with a small US-based team.

- Is curious about the film/TV production world (experience is a plus, but not required) and likes the idea of supporting studios and production teams with better data.

- If you are someone who naturally spots inconsistencies in spreadsheets, enjoys making dashboards more useful, and loves the feeling of a well-organized CRM, youâ€™ll likely be a great fit.



-

[ Requirements ]



Must-have:

a. Able to work full-time.



b. Consistent availability Monday-Friday with required overlap of 2 PMâ€“5 PM Pacific Time (PST/PDT).



c. Strong, hands-on experience with HubSpot CRM, especially:

- Managing contacts, companies, and deals

- Running and customizing reports and dashboards

- Importing/exporting data and performing data clean-ups



d. Experience with at least some of: Asana, Google Workspace, Slack, or similar remote tools.



e. Comfortable following and creating documentation (SOPs / WoW) and updating processes.



f. Excellent written communication in English and solid reading comprehension.



Technical & logistical:

a. Reliable primary internet connection (we will ask for a recent speed test).



b. A backup internet option (e.g., mobile data, hotspot, pocket WiFi) in case of outages.



c. A practical plan for dealing with power interruptions (charged laptop, power bank, generator, or alternative work location).



d. Access to a reliable computer and a dedicated workspace suitable for focused remote work.



Nice-to-have (bonus):

a. Experience with other CRMs or sales tools.



b. Experience in the film/TV, media, or entertainment space.



c. Prior experience supporting a US-based startup or remote team.



d. Experience creating simple visualizations (charts in Sheets, basic dashboards, or simple layouts in Canva).



-

[ How to Apply ]

Weâ€™re moving quickly and would like to hire by the end of next week (or sooner if we find the right person).



To apply, please follow these steps carefully:



1. Reply to this job posting with your interest. 



2. Complete our application form

- You will answer a set of questions about your experience, availability, and work style.

- You will also provide details about your internet connection, backup plans, and work setup.



3. Record a short Loom or video (2â€“3 minutes)

- Introduce yourself.

- Briefly describe your experience with HubSpot (what have you actually done inside HubSpot?).

- Share one example of a report, dashboard, or data-cleanup project youâ€™ve handled and what impact it had.

- Tell us why youâ€™re interested in working with Ironslate and supporting studios/production teams.



4. Share the following in the form:

- Link to your OnlineJobs.ph profile.

- Your expected monthly salary (in USD) for a full-time role.

- A screenshot or link to a recent internet speed test.



Applications that follow these instructions carefully will be prioritized.



---

If this role sounds like a match for your skills and the way you like to work, weâ€™d love to hear from you!

title: CapCut Video Editor for Gaming Sleep Channel (Gaming Knowledge Required)

???? PAY:



$200/month to start (3-4 videos/week)

Increases as you take on more responsibilities

???? TO APPLY:



1. CapCut portfolio (2-3 videos)

2. Answer:

   â€¢ Which of these games have you played/watched? (Skyrim, Elden Ring, Oblivion)

   â€¢ Can you deliver within 12-24 hours consistently?

3. Confirm you'll do a paid trial video



Start: Within 1 week of hiring

title: Email Marketing Specialist Needed
description:
**About the Role**



We are looking for a dual-threat
 Marketer who is technically proficient in **Klaviyo** and creatively skilled in **design**. In this role, you will own the
 retention channel, building complex automation flows while ensuring every
 looks on-brand and drives conversions. You will be responsible for the full lifecycle of the subscriberâ€”from the first popup signup to the VIP post-purchase experience.



### **Key Responsibilities**



#### **1. Flow Architecture & Automation**



* **Build & Manage Flows:** Construct and optimize core revenue-generating flows (Welcome Series, Abandoned Cart, Browse Abandonment, Post-Purchase, Win-Back, Cross-Sell).

* **Advanced Segmentation:** Create dynamic segments based on purchase behavior, engagement, and customer properties to ensure hyper-personalized messaging.

* **A/B Testing:** Continuously test subject lines, time delays, and content within flows to improve Open Rates, Click-Through Rates (CTR), and Revenue Per Recipient.



#### **2.
 Design & Creative Strategy**



* **Visual Design:** Design high-converting, mobile-responsive
 templates using **Figma**, **Canva**, **Photoshop**, or Klaviyoâ€™s native editor.

* **Brand Consistency:** Ensure all assets (hero images, GIFs, typography, layouts) align perfectly with our brand identity.

* **Copywriting:** Write punchy, engaging, and sales-driven copy for subject lines, headlines, and body text.



#### **3. Campaign Management & Strategy**



* **Campaign Calendar:** Plan and execute the monthly broadcast calendar, coordinating with product launches, sales events, and holidays.

* **List Growth & Hygiene:** Manage lead capture forms (popups/flyouts) to maximize signups and maintain high deliverability by regularly cleaning unengaged subscribers.



#### **4. Analytics & Reporting**



* **Data Analysis:** Monitor key metrics (Open Rate, Click Rate, Conversion Rate, Unsubscribe Rate) and provide weekly/monthly reports on performance.

* **Optimization:** Use data to identify bottlenecks in flows and opportunities for higher engagement.



---



### **Qualifications**



* **Experience:** 2+ years of proven experience managing Klaviyo for eCommerce (DTC) brands.

* **Platform Mastery:** Deep understanding of Klaviyoâ€™s triggers, filters, conditional splits, and dynamic codes.

* **Design Eye:** Strong portfolio demonstrating an ability to create visually stunning
s (proficiency in Figma/Adobe/Canva).

* **Copywriting:** Strong command of English grammar with an ability to write "sell-focused" copy.

* **Technical:** Basic understanding of HTML/CSS for
 troubleshooting is a plus.

* **Analytical:** Comfortable working with data to drive decisions.

title: Graphic Designer (Juniorâ€“Mid Level Welcome) â€” Print Production & Layout Systems
description:
Remote Graphic Designer â€” Print Production & Layout Systems ($3.50/hr Trial $3.75â€“$4.00/hr Long-Term)



Iâ€™m building a structured, scalable print production environment across multiple brands and looking for a graphic designer who enjoys creating designs that go directly into real-world printing and production.

This is not a one-off freelance project, this is a long-term internal operational role.



All business workflows and infrastructure details will be shared after NDA and hiring.



What Youâ€™ll Be Doing (Examples Only â€” Not Limited To):



â€¢ Create graphic designs for print products (business cards, flyers, postcards, signage, etc.)

â€¢ Enjoy structured workflows and repeatable systems

â€¢ Fast responder and organized communicator

Work Style & Communication Expectations:

Minimum Requirements â€” Do Not Apply If:

Pay & Commitment:

â€¢ Paid weekly initially ? bi-weekly after onboarding

â€¢ Long-term growth opportunity as production systems expand



Schedule (REQUIRED):



â€¢ Monday â€“ Friday

mber and get started

title: Customer Service Team Lead (Starting Role) | Health Tech Company | Full-Time Remote
description:
About the role: We're not just another remote job. We're a mission-driven health technology company helping thousands of older Americans reduce chronic pain and avoid unnecessary medications. We're growing fast, and we need someone exceptionally detail-oriented to handle customer service and content tasks using AI tools.



Our customers are older adults (50+) who are often skeptical, technically challenged, and need compassionate, clear communication. You'll be their main point of contact.



This role is 60% customer service, 40% content work.



What you'll actually be doing:



Customer Service (Primary Focus - 60% of time):

- Respond to 20-30 customer inquiries daily 
 & chat) in our ticketing system

- Use Claude AI to draft responses, then critically review and personalize them

- Adapt our
 templates (makros) to each customer's specific situation

- Read full conversation history before responding, context is everything

- Handle returns, warranty cases, medical questions following our protocols

- Know when to escalate vs. handle independently



Content & Marketing (40% of time):

- Write science-backed blog posts with AI assistance (you prompt, proofread, fact-check, optimize)

- Create social media content with Canva (using our templates)

- Schedule posts and engage with our audience

- Reach out to health & wellness influencers for partnerships (80% automated already)



Critical requirements (no exceptions):

- 5+ years of customer service experience (preferably in health, wellness, or medical devices)

- Near-native English (our customers are American seniors)

- Proven experience using AI tools (Claude, ChatGPT, etc.). You should already be using AI in your current work

- Experience with project management tools (ClickUp, Asana, Trello etc)

- Obsessive attention to detail. You catch mistakes others miss

- Fast learner who takes notes and doesn't repeat mistakes

- Excellent internet connection and professional workspace



You'll struggle in this role if you:

- Copy-paste AI responses without critical thinking

- Don't read full context before responding

- Tend to make the same mistake over and over again

- Need constant supervision

- Work multiple jobs and can't focus



What makes someone successful here:

- Read full context before responding (you're thorough, not rushed)

- Customize templates thoughtfully (not copy-paste)

- Think critically about whether your responses make sense

- Take pride in helping people solve real problems

- Want to build something, not just clock hours

- See feedback as a gift, not criticism

- You work independently but know when to ask for help



What makes this opportunity different:

- Career growth path: We're hiring for a Customer Service Specialist today, but we're building toward a Customer Service Team Lead role. As we scale, the right person will lead our support team, train new hires, and shape our customer experience strategy. 

- Competitive compensation: $1,000 - $1,200/month USD for full-time (40 hours/week) with true growth potential.

- Paid time off: 15 days paid annual leave (includes public holidays, you choose when to take them).

- Professional development: Access to courses, AI tools, and direct mentorship from our founder. We invest in people who invest in themselves.

- Flexible schedule (must overlap at least 3 hours with Thailand time)

- Process-driven company with comprehensive training with documentation, videos, and daily feedback

- Cutting-edge tools: You'll work with the latest AI technology. This isn't data entry, you're learning skills that will be valuable for years to come.

- Meaningful work: Our customers are grandparents who want to play with their grandkids without pain, veterans managing injuries, people avoiding opioids. Your work directly improves lives.

- Stability with a startup: We're profitable, growing steadily, and been in business for 3 years. You get startup opportunity without the risk.



Our hiring process:

1) Video application (3-5 min) - see questions below

2) Video interview (30 min) - we'll get to know you, answer your questions & test your thinking

3) Paid trial task (4 hours, $50) - customer service scenarios to filter for skills. Tests attention to detail, AI usage, customer service judgment

4) Trial week (20 hours, $160) - Work with real tickets. We will filter for learning ability & work ethic.

5) Probation month ($1,000) - for both of us to understand whether we're a good fit



This is a high bar. We've had candidates with 10+ years of experience not work out because they lacked attention to detail and didn't learn from mistakes. If you're not someone who naturally catches details and learns quickly, this isn't the right fit.



To apply, create a video (Use Loom, Dubb or similar tools) answering these questions:

1) Customer service experience: Tell me about your experience (years, industry etc) and mention one of the most challenging tickets you worked on and how you resolved it.

2) AI usage: How do you currently use AI in your work? Be specific with tools and tasks

3) Why you: Let us know why you think we should choose you over other candidates



Your video should be max 5 minutes. Applications without video will be automatically rejected.

title: Commercial Manager
description:
Commercial Manager

Vantage Group

Remote / Hybrid | Full-Time

Commercial Structuring, Pricing Strategy, Contract Architecture



About Vantage Group

Vantage Group is a facilities management execution platform built to bring structure, accountability, and operational control to interior and exterior services across complex property portfolios.

We work with owners, operators, and private real estate groups who are tired of:

Managing fragmented vendor networks

Chasing missed services and incomplete work

Lacking visibility and documentation

Escalating issues without enforcement authority

Overloading internal teams with coordination chaos

Vantage is not a property management company.

We are the operating and accountability infrastructure between ownership and execution.

We are building this company deliberately â€” with systems, economic discipline, and long-term enterprise value in mind.



The Opportunity

We are seeking a Commercial Manager to own the economic architecture and structural integrity of every deal entering the company.

- This is not a junior estimating role.

- This is not a bid compilation position.

- This is not a sales support function.

This role is responsible for protecting margin, structuring contracts correctly, defining SLAs, and ensuring that every portfolio we onboard is operationally executable and economically sound.

In a young, lean, high-growth platform, this position is foundational.



Role Mission

The Commercial Manager exists to ensure that:

- Every proposal is structurally clear

- Every contract reflects enforceable standards

- Every deal meets margin guardrails

- Every SLA is measurable and enforceable

- No bad revenue enters the company

- You are the economic filter and structural architect of Vantage Group.



Core Responsibilities

1. Proposal Development & Commercial Structuring

Translate client scope into structured service architecture

Build detailed proposals for:

Recurring contracted services

Emergency services

Capital projects

Ensure clarity between scope, SLA expectations, and vendor execution

Standardize proposal templates and continuously improve them

Maintain version control and document integrity



2. Pricing Strategy & Margin Protection

Apply margin framework (target 70â€“80% gross margin)

Validate that retainers cover baseline delivery costs

Analyze vendor pricing and normalize for comparison

Reject underpriced or structurally weak deals

Conduct sensitivity analysis on larger portfolios

Escalate misaligned deals to COO when required

You will have authority to stop deals that violate guardrails.



3. Contract Architecture

Draft and structure client agreements

Define:

Retainer structure

Margin participation terms

Emergency pricing framework

SLA enforcement language

Escalation authority

Ensure contracts align with operational reality

Maintain contract templates and structure documentation



4. SLA Design & Enforcement Framework

Define measurable SLAs for:

Response times

Completion times

Quality standards

Documentation requirements

Customize SLA structures by service category

Align SLAs with vendor capability and enforcement posture

Ensure SLA standards are installed before onboarding



5. Vendor Pricing & Commercial Review

Review vendor quotes for scope alignment

Identify pricing inconsistencies

Normalize pricing across markets

Apply margin before client presentation

Maintain vendor pricing database



6. Deal Handoff & Operational Alignment

Create structured deal summary package for Account Operations

Ensure AOM receives:

Final scope

SLA structure

Vendor coverage

Risk flags

Margin summary

Prevent incomplete handoffs

Participate in onboarding discussions when required



7. Emergency Pricing & Rapid Response Structuring

Apply margin to emergency quotes quickly

Validate scope and cost alignment

Build rapid-turn pricing templates

Protect margin under speed conditions



8. Continuous Commercial Optimization

Analyze pricing objections

Refine retainer models

Improve SLA structures

Provide feedback to leadership

Identify automation opportunities in pricing workflows



What Success Looks Like

You will know you are succeeding when:

- Deals move from proposal to execution with minimal confusion

- Margin guardrails are consistently met

- Few pricing exceptions are requested

- Scope disputes decrease

- Founders are no longer reviewing individual deal economics

- Operational friction decreases post-sale



What This Role Is Not

- Not a task processor

- Not a passive estimator

- Not a junior contract administrator

- Not a quote compiler

- Not a sales assistant

- This role requires judgment, economic awareness, and structural thinking.



Required Experience

We are looking for candidates with experience such as:

- Commercial estimating in facilities, construction, or multi-trade environments

- Contract management in property or service industries

- Pricing strategy for multi-site service organizations

- Facilities operations finance

- Commercial project management with economic oversight



You should have:

- 5+ years of experience in commercial estimating or contract structuring

- Experience pricing multi-location service portfolios

- Strong understanding of margin modeling

- Experience working with SLAs

- High attention to detail

- Strong written communication skills

- Comfort working in structured systems

- Experience in facilities management, construction, multi-trade services, or property operations is strongly preferred.

- Characteristics We Value

- Economically disciplined

- Process-driven

- Structured thinker

- Calm under pressure

- Clear communicator

 - Comfortable challenging weak scope

- High personal accountability

- Not emotionally attached to â€œclosing dealsâ€



Reporting Structure

- Reports to: General Manager

Works closely with:

- COO (economic oversight)

- Strategic Development Lead

- Vendor Network Development Manager

- Account Operations Manager



Growth Path

As Vantage scales, this role can evolve into:

- Director of Commercial Operations

- VP of Commercial Strategy

- Chief Commercial Officer

- We are building for scale. Strong operators grow with us.



Compensation

- Competitive salary based on experience ($850 - $1,100 per month)

- Performance alignment incentives

- Opportunity to grow with a high-upside platform

- Details will be discussed with qualified candidates.



Why Join Vantage

- You will help architect a platform from the ground up

- You will work within a disciplined, systems-first structure

- You will not operate in chaos

- You will not be micromanaged

- You will be evaluated objectively

- You will build something that scales

-This is not a corporate bureaucracy.

-This is a serious operating team building an institutional-quality platform.



How to Apply

Please submit:

Your resume

- A brief (3â€“5 minute) Loom video explaining:

     - Your relevant work experience 

     - why do you think you would be a good fit for the position?

     - What do you like to do outside of work? 



Candidates who demonstrate clarity, structure, and economic awareness will be prioritized.

title: ClickFunnels Specialist
description:
Job Title: ClickFunnels Specialist (Part-Time, Potential for Full-Time)



Company: Great Carports



Location: Remote (Work from Anywhere)



Pay: $1,600 per month or $10 per hour at 40 hours per week



Schedule: 7pm-9pm EST Mon-Thu plus one 4-hour shift on the weekends.



Must be able to work the specified schedule for the first 6 months, after which you will transition to full-time and work Mon-Thu.



About Us:



Great Carports is a leading provider of metal and steel buildings, serving North and South Carolina. We specialize in custom carports, garages, agricultural buildings, and other steel structures, delivered and professionally installed. We are a rapidly growing company with a fun and dynamic team, committed to delivering quality and satisfaction to our customers. Join us on this exciting journey and grow your career with us!



Job Description:



We are looking for a creative and enthusiastic ClickFunnels Specialist to join our team on a part-time basis, with the potential to transition to a full-time role if itâ€™s a good fit. This is an exciting opportunity to work remotely, make a significant impact on our business growth and online presence, and have fun while doing it! As a ClickFunnels Specialist at Great Carports, you will play a key role in developing, managing, and optimizing our sales funnels to drive traffic and conversions.



Responsibilities:



- Develop and implement ClickFunnels strategies to attract and convert potential customers.

- Create and optimize sales funnels, landing pages, and lead generation forms.

- Conduct A/B testing to identify high-performing funnel elements.

- Monitor and analyze funnel performance, making data-driven adjustments to improve results.

- Collaborate with the marketing team to align ClickFunnels campaigns with overall marketing goals.

- Optimize funnel pages for maximum conversion rates.

- Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in ClickFunnels and digital marketing.

- Participate in frequent live meetings, screen sharing, and video conferences.

- Be available to work the schedule of 7pm-9pm EST Mon-Thu plus one 4-hour shift on the weekends, including occasional nights and additional weekend hours, especially when getting started or when there is a big job to meet deadlines.

- Must be able to work the specified schedule for the first 6 months, after which you will transition to full-time and work Mon-Thu.



Qualifications:



- Proven experience as a ClickFunnels Specialist with a strong track record of success.

- Extensive knowledge of ClickFunnels and sales funnel optimization.

- Strong analytical skills and experience with digital marketing metrics.

- Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

- Ability to work independently and manage time effectively in a fast-paced environment.

- Must have a quiet place to work with reliable power and internet.

- Must have a good microphone and speak English very well.



What We Offer:



- Competitive pay: $1,600 per month or $10 per hour at 40 hours per week.

- Flexible work schedule, starting part-time with the potential for full-time employment.

- Opportunities for professional growth and development.

- A fun, creative, and collaborative work environment.

- Potential for full-time employment with benefits including health, dental, and vision insurance, paid time off, and holidays.

- An exciting journey with a growing company where your contributions make a real impact.



Do Not Apply If:



- You are unable to work the schedule of 7pm-9pm EST Mon-Thu plus one 4-hour shift on the weekends, including occasional nights and additional weekend hours.

- You do not have a quiet place to work with reliable power and internet.

- You do not have a good microphone and camera for frequent video conferences.

- You are not proficient in English.

- You cannot manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.



How to Apply:



If you are a passionate and skilled ClickFunnels Specialist looking to join a dynamic and fun team on a part-time basis, with the potential for full-time employment, we would love to hear from you! Please text your name and the position you are applying for to WhatsApp +1 (704)
. Also, include one of your favorite emojis and tell us why it is one of your favorites.



Great Carports is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: VFX / Visual Impact Editor - Lethal Luxury Short-Form Video
description:
VFX / Visual Impact Editor - Lethal Luxury Short-Form Video



Brand: Prismiera (Luxury Jewelry)

Pay: $1100 USD/month

Type: Full-time, 40 hours/week

Location: Remote (Philippines)

Software: Premiere Pro + After Effects (mandatory)



---



The Mission



Prismiera is a pre-launch luxury jewelry brand launching a short-form video series - 35â€“50 second stories about mythology, history, spies, poisoners, queens, alchemists, and other on-brand topics posted across TikTok, Reels, and YouTube Shorts.



The aesthetic is History and mythology meets high fashion. The editing energy leans closer to a perfectly-timed After Effects edit / storytelling than a corporate product video. (You have an eye for aesthetics and cinematography)



You will receive a script, a voiceover file, and a mood reference. Your job is to build the scene from nothing: generate AI visuals, voiceovers, source archival footage, layer sound design, and deliver a short where every second earns the next. A visual storyteller. (We provide access to the frontier generation models)



---



The Style



YES: Dark luxury. Museum. AE VFX edit. Stylish/Lethal. Fun. Rich textures. Clean typography. Controlled palette. Both silence and impact used with intention.



NO: CapCut default presets. Anything that looks like a stock photo slideshow or a corporate deck.



You understand that more effects does not necessarily mean better. Every cut has a reason.



---



Core Skills (Non-Negotiables)



Motion Graphics - You can build scenes, transitions, and visual elements from scratch in After Effects - not just cut footage.



Voiceover-First Storytelling - You are editing to a narration primarily, music track second. You know when to let a line breathe and when to accelerate. You never bury the script's punchline under a flashy transition. The voice leads - the visuals serve.



Retention Instinct - You understand that the first frame is an ad for the second frame. You know what stops a scroll. You build hooks visually, not just with text overlays. Every 2â€“3 seconds, something changes.



Rhythm & Beat-Sync - You can sync cuts, zooms, and effects to music. You understand "the drop." If you've made AMVs, fan/anime edits, or phonk edits, you already have this skill - we want you to apply it with restraint.



AI-Assisted Asset Creation - You are comfortable generating images and short clips using tools like Midjourney or Kling. (We usually move onto new tools as soon as they are released). You treat AI as a production tool, not a novelty. We provide all paid accounts - you bring the creative judgment.



---



Bonus Skills (Not Required, But We'll Notice)



- After Effects compositing - Mocha tracking, light matching (future projects will involve product placement in video scenes)

- Typography sense - fonts that feel intentional, never default

- Color grading - pushing AI output and footage into a consistent palette

- Sound design beyond music - layering SFX on movement, crafting risers and hits



---



Weekly Output



Ramp-up (first 2â€“3 weeks): 2â€“3 shorts as you learn the brand voice and pipeline.

Steady state: 4â€“5 shorts per week at the locked quality standard.



You will work from clear creative briefs with reference scripts, mood boards, and audio clips for most batches.



---



How to Apply



Do not send a generic cover letter.

Use 7 apply points or more when applying.



Subject line: Lethal Editor - [Your name]



Send the following (in this order):



1. The Story Test. Link to ONE short-form video you edited that includes voiceover or spoken dialogue. We need to see that you can pace visuals to a script.



2. The AE Style Test. Link to ONE video that shows your visual rhythm and editing craft - an AMV, fan edit, fashion reel, or anything where the editing itself is the skill. It doesn't need to be "dark" or "luxury." It needs to show us how you think about pacing and impact.



3. AI Experience (1 sentence). What is your experience level with generative AI tools (Midjourney, seedream, Kling, etc.)? If none, say so - we'll evaluate the rest of your application on its own merits.



4. Hardware. Your PC specs: CPU / GPU / RAM. Plus your internet upload speed.



5. Turnaround Estimate. How long does a 30â€“50 second high-quality short typically take you, start to finish?



6. The Rewrite. Rewrite this sentence to sound dark, powerful, and modern: "She is really cool and strong and she wins."



---



Paid Trial (Shortlisted Candidates)



Before any full-time commitment, we run a weekly paid trial. We provide real scripts and style references. You deliver 30â€“50 second shorts. Trial is compensated at $250 USD at the end of each week (after work). If it's a mutual fit after 30 days, we transition to $550 USD payments every 2 weeks (before work).



This protects both of us - you see whether the work fits your strengths, we see whether the output fits our brand.



---



What We Offer



- Paid accounts for all frontier AI tools; seedance2.0, seedream5.0, etc.

- Creative identity - you're building the visual identity of a brand from launch, not filling someone else's template

- Clear briefs - most, if not every batch comes with scripts, audio files, mood boards, and specific reference videos

- Direct feedback - specific, constructive notes on every edit.

- A brand worth building - Prismiera launches April 2026. A second AI native game/anime brand after that. You're not joining a machine. You're helping build one.

title: Own Your Resultsâ€”Own Your Future
description:
(Cold Call Predator & Elite Closer | Real Base + Uncapped Pay | Full Autonomy & High Accountability)



Own Your Resultsâ€”Own Your Future



Most companies talk about opportunity; we pay for itâ€”every single month. Our best earners donâ€™t chase quotasâ€”they lap them. If you want a long-term sales seat (not a â€œgigâ€), extreme autonomy, and direct advancement based solely on metrics, read on. If not, keep scrolling.



Your Mission



100+ outbound calls per day to distressed property owners (tax defaults, inheritance, liens, etc.â€”you find the pain, you build rapport, you close)



Zero handoffs: You control the deal from initial outreach through close. No pass-offs, no excuses, no â€œsupportâ€ teams to blame



Live in your numbers: You log every lead, every call, every stageâ€”real-time, every day. Pipeline management is not optional.



Transparent scoreboard: Your results are public. You know exactly where you stand. Your pay and growth = your production. Period.



What We Provide



Real base (not a â€œdrawâ€): You start with a guaranteed income while you stack your pipeline

title: SEO Article Writer & Trend Researcher (3D Printing & Tech)
description:
We are a Canadian-based technology and e-commerce company operating multiple online brands in 3D printing, servers, and technical products. Our websites help customers research, compare, and buy specialized equipment and services.



We publish practical, search-driven content that answers real questions people are actively searching on Google, Reddit, and online communities.



We are looking for a writer who understands how people search online and can turn those searches into useful, high-quality articles and discussions.



Role Overview

Your primary role is to identify topics people are searching for and create helpful articles and supporting discussions around those topics.



You will research search trends using tools like AnswerThePublic, Google Trends, Reddit, and forums, then write SEO-focused content for our websites that answers those questions clearly and accurately.



You will also participate in relevant Reddit and forum discussions to help surface and reference our content in a natural way.



This is not spam or low-quality link building. The goal is authentic, helpful content and participation in real discussions.



Responsibilities

- Topic & Trend Research

- Find article ideas using AnswerThePublic, Google Trends, Reddit, forums, and search results

- Identify common questions, comparisons, and buying intent topics

- Propose content ideas based on real search demand

- SEO Article Writing

- Write clear, helpful articles based on researched topics

- Ensure articles match search intent and answer the userâ€™s question

- Use AI tools to assist drafting when appropriate

- Edit and fact-check AI content for accuracy and readability

- Format content for WordPress or similar CMS



Community Participation

- Identify relevant Reddit threads and discussions

- Create genuine discussion posts when appropriate

- Participate in conversations naturally and helpfully

- Reference useful resources (including our content) where relevant

- Maintain multiple professional discussion accounts responsibly



Content Optimization

- Improve existing articles based on new trends

- Add FAQs and structured sections based on search data

- Help strengthen internal linking across our sites



Content Topics

You will write primarily about:

- 3D Printing

- 3D printers, filaments, materials, troubleshooting

- Comparisons, buying guides, how-to content

- Industry suppliers and services



Servers & Hosting

- Linux servers, Windows servers, VPS, dedicated hosting

- Performance, setup, comparisons, troubleshooting

- Infrastructure and technical guides



Other Technical Brands

- Manufacturing and technology products

- B2B suppliers and services

- Equipment and tools

 

Requirements

- Strong written English

- Experience writing SEO articles

- Ability to research topics independently

- Understanding of search intent and keyword targeting

- Comfortable using AI writing tools and editing outputs

- Familiar with Reddit and online forums

- Organized and detail-oriented



Nice to Have

- Experience in 3D printing or tech topics

- Basic understanding of SEO

- Experience with WordPress

- Experience researching buyer-intent keywords



How We Work

- We discuss brand guidelines and topic direction

- You propose article ideas based on search research

- Articles are reviewed and published by you

- Long-term role with consistent content needs

- Multiple brands and ongoing work available



To Apply

Please include:

- Links to SEO articles you wrote

- Your experience with research tools (AnswerThePublic, Trends, Reddit, etc.)

- Your process for finding article topics

- Your monthly rate or per-article rate or per hour
